contact-comment:
Comments: 
Meeting with finsbury-
Financial comms, corporate comms and financial pr Reputation all work Brunswick closest competitor Top end of FTS100 Tier 50 work less of

Strong global footprint- London and New York two largest offices
Brussels- public affairs office
Digital sits across everything 

Values- eye for detail
Top tier business
Self starters
Thrive best when they're not over managed 

Do a lot of pro bono work
Everybody is allowed a day off a year to do charity project

Volkswagen
Hutchinson 

Looking to hire a senior associate, would look at either side for the right person Someone that can grow with Pension 8% individual gives 3% Send cvs to Laura and Katie Someone that doesn't need structure or predictability Broader sense of team wants to collaborate, people who are use to working alone doesn't work well for them 

Annual review on December -feb
Bonus get paid in March
10-20% bonus
Half year more team leader driven
Promotions affective 1st April, occasionally September/October Metricratic environment 

Not keen on spec's

Senior Associate Digital 

Yim
Advisor
X2 executives
Team assistant 

Dynamic, entrepernuiral
Yim runs tech and media team
Head of digital for two years
Freelancers who do production side of things Quite small in terms of people they have 

Very strategic work, won't do community management Content going out into the market, community manager Sits firmly in the finsbury model of higher fees advisory Everyone uses them Works with the teams to get the sector ideas 

What works well on social media, cultural surrounding communications Very corp-Sumer focused Opportunity to go to New York, Abu Dubai Run campaigns, give strategic advise, bring the team along with them, collaborative, fresh ideas Every clients wants this digital offering Starbucks

Looking at the narrative for the business, using all the information to allow the team to operate offline Overarching strategy- listening piece, looking at the data Content news rooms, communicating with financial audiences, targeted audiences Content strategy SEO, paid search They will have to create digital comms strategy 

Wants to trust them, strong attention to detail 

Not bothered by education
Open to all backgrounds
Self starter, collaborative, team player, get in there and listen to what the clients

Agencies-
Brunswick
FTI
Edelman
Blue rubicon
Weber Shandwick

Infographic, to video, lots of scope to be creative Where do you get digital first How to switch on a campaign 

Just started the search

Confidence- not drown them in digital language Explain digital clearly

Potentially up to £70,000

contact-comment:
Comments: SUMMARY

Suzi is currently a consultant for LCA having just returned from travelling through southern Africa and Canada following living in Burundi for three months. There she was advising the Dutch Government on the communications around their Security Sector Development programme. Prior to that Suzi has been based in pr consultancy in London.

Suzi joined LCA in January 2005 and was promoted to Director in November 2010. Her clients included Metropolitan Police Property Services, Covent Garden Market Authority, Wycombe Community Sports Development Limited and South London Business.

At LCA Suzi was responsible for leading on each of these clients on a day to day basis, attending client meetings and providing strategic advice at a senior level. She also was the Director responsible for new business working with the Executive Chairman. Client work included large scale community consultation, stakeholder engagement and mapping, event management and media relations. Suzi was also responsible for coordinating and managing the LCA Resources Pack – an internal intranet system known as Elsie for sharing LCA knowledge amongst staff.

Having worked since 2002 in public relations consultancy Suzi has primarily focused on commercial property and the built environment sector in both the public and private fields. She previously worked for Stanhope on their Chiswick Park and Hemel Hempstead developments and CB Richard Ellis with their planning and public sector consultancy teams, Chelsfield at Brierley Hill. 

Suzi graduated from Exeter University in 2000 with a degree in geography after which she undertook a 6 month work placement at Abbey National in their corporate relations team.

Specialties: Planning consultation, regeneration and property, policing, stakeholder communications, internal communication, strategy development
EXPERIENCE


Freelance Consultant
London Communications Agency
February 2012 – Present (1 year)London / south east
Freelance consultant working across accounts and new business opportunities
Consultant
Burundian Security Sector Development Programme
July 2011 – October 2011 (4 months)Bujumbura, Burundi
Providing communications advice and support to the Dutch Government who are leading the Security Sector Development Programme in Burundi.

Director
London Communications Agency
January 2005 – July 2011 (6 years 7 months)
- Senior member of LCA team
- Director responsible for new business
- Direct line management of two team members
- Completed Ashridge Management course (2008)
- Wrote and presented report of Boris first year as Mayor to over 100 senior clients and contacts along with Boris and his senior advisors
- Responsible for setting up and running LCA intranet
Account Manager
Tamesis
July 2002 – December 2004 (2 years 6 months)
(Open)1 recommendation

Harriet Swatman
Head of Facing Communications
Suzi is perhaps the most switched-on, time-efficient account manager I have had the pleasure to work alongside. She is very sharp and does not miss a trick.View
Account Executive
Abbey
2000 – 2001 (1 year)
(Open)1 recommendation

Niki Bolton
Corporate Communications Manager at esure
Suzi is enthusiastic, energetic and gives 100 per cent to everything she does - on both a personal and professional level. She sets high standards for herself and her bubbly personality is infectious. Suzi was a great asset at Abbey as she started...View

contact-comment:
Comments: Meeting with Naomi at Hudson Sandler 20.1.2016
Michael Sandler - still at top/founder. Andrew (CEO). 
10x on board - Andrew, Michael, Alex (COO), Kirsty, Wendy, Charlie, David, Kat, Maria (Dirs)
Humble, fun, curious, thoughtful, collaborative, passionate  - values 
No divisions - Andrew doesn't want silos. Corporate Brand, Russia, Capital Markets 

Everyone reports into Kirsty. 
Titling: Client exec (AE), client mgr (AM), client dir (AD), Dir
Kat Valentine - cap mkts. Based in Yorkshire, nbd focused. Local regional work. 
Reward Gateway client (Corp), Baccaval: Icelandic fast food clients (financial client), 
Need stronger digital creds 
Corp: 7 ppl. FPR: 12 ppl. Russian: 7 ppl/2 in HK. 35 in company. 
11 leavers (4-5 pushed) in 2015. None went to competitor. Mixed levels 

Russian team AD - FPR. Russian banks, RDIF O&G. Full time / mat leave. Not much direct. 

Naomi uses 2-3 recruiters on any live brief

SAE/AM - FPR need. Cap mkts FS. £28-32K

Corp senior - grey hairs. Crisis JD. This week. 
Huntsworth: on radar but left to it. Less red tape

Motential for capital markets and CC Director role - would retain something on this level.

contact-comment:
Comments: Senior Account Manager
Duke Interactive 
(Public Company ; 51-200 employees ; Internet industry)
September 2007 - Present ( 9 months) 

Strategy
• Contributing to the re-appraisal of the Nissan brand by pro-actively initiating local online activities for local business performance.
• Following up local site and traffic performance
Management
• Coordinating local RBU to understand and report local requests to Nissan Europe.
• Responsible for the quality of the localized site deliveries, including testing and change management.


European Collateral Project Manager
Apple Computer Europe, UK 
(Public Company ; 1001-5000 employees ; Consumer Electronics industry)
June 2006 - August 2007 (1 year 3 months) 

Strategy
• Leading a strategic study with the objective of increasing synergy
between individual reseller needs and targeted merchandising and
collateral solutions in 17 countries.
• Developing flexible POS tools to support sales in new emerging
markets (iPod, iTunes Music Store & Apple TV).
• Developing a project management platform to improve merchandising
workflow.
Management
• Managing a merchandising budget ($1,7 Million/quarter).
• Briefing, follow up and management of external localization, artwork
designer, production and shipment agencies (4 UK based agencies) in a
highly pressurized environment.
• Interfacing with US worldwide team and managing country-based
Marcom team initiatives.
Production & Coordination
• Developing local collateral production in emerging countries.
• Implementing worldwide Store-in-Store program in 75 retailers across
Europe.

European Product Marcom Coordinator
Apple Europe Computer, France 
(Privately Held ; 1001-5000 employees ; Computer Hardware industry)
August 2003 - June 2006 (2 years 11 months) 

Strategy
• Ensured that programs adhere & support both corporate strategy and
European business objectives.
Production & Coordination
• Promoting and implementing collateral and merchandising tools for the
European market.
• Localization, and production of tools and programs across 17
countries in 7 languages.
• Supported 70 product launches with adapted communication tools for
resellers, PR, country sales, Product Marketing & VP.

Education

Ecole supérieure de Commerce de Rouen 
Master, Corporate Communication, 2003 - 2004 

Ecole supérieure de Commerce de Rouen 
Bachelor, International Marketing, 1999 - 2003 

Goucher College 
Associate Degree, International Studies, 2000 - 2001

contact-comment:
Comments: Happy where he is but open to looking. Been at FTI 2 years

Started at Tesco on grad Scheme - then moved into IR there and enjoyed it and then put his hand up for a digital role.

Focus on CC and digital at FTI - broad sectors - real estate, fs, pharma. Not bothered re sector.

He sees himself as more of a corp comms person than digital. No FPR. Got digi exoertise but doesnt want to be a digital specialist

Enjoying it at the moment - keen to broaden back out to other areas - int comms, broader comms, med rels.

Would look at IH. Enjoys agency and not fussy about that. Job and interresting ppl more key for him.

Salary: £78K. Bonus too. AssD level

contact-comment:
Comments: 05 Feb 2016 AG:
- breakfast meeting at The Delaunay. 
- interested in candidates for a Director role in his PA team at Edelman, mentioned not being satisfied getting the people he wants through internal channels in HR talent team. 
- made some senior hires in his team to date - Sara Rajeswaran joining last year as the Associate Director level. 
- now a team of 25, he has increased this from 13 since he has been there. 
- ran the profiles of GEmma Doyle, Joanna Robotham and Fiona Holyrode past him. definitely wanted to meet Gemma and Joanna. 
- his team are PA focussed but also do a lot of digital, crisis comms, etc. 
- says he can 'sort out' his HR team from his end to get them to work with us. 
- if he was looking at the market he would like to go in-house to a big global NGO type.

contact-comment:
Comments: 25/01/2012

She is brilliant, really liked her and she is very strong 
She has created her digital roles for her in every business she has worked in 
strong corporate experience having started he career as a PA and then moved into Investor relations 
it was here that she mentioned to the CEO that the website neeeded changing and then her digital experience took off

She spent a long time at Land Securities and progressed quickly before she got made redundant 

she then joined a digital agency to set up theit london office - it was great to get some agency experince but she was the only one in the office and after a year they told her there was no longer a role!! 

Royal Mail came at the right time - she was so attracted by the role but not so much the company
however she has achieved so much and really overhauled the whole comms team 

@ Royal Mail she worked on a complete restructure and has transformmed digital comms

currently manages a team of 6 

58 in total in comms and marketing and 6 strands 

she oversees digital comms 

Very switched on, strong character and understands the challenges of working within the tech space in digital 

won awards as well as being on the panel for the digiawards and the digital impact awards

next role: preference would be in-house but she is also open to agency 
if it was agency it would need to be a reputable agency with good clients
no to small, medium start-up agencies

client side: open, no the public sector and charity 

good at strategic counsel 

interviewed H&K - senior digital strategist 
Design Council - digital project role 

also working with several recruitment agencies, seems to know a fair few 

Salary - £63k plus £5k car
also full family healthcare but because it is just her she gets an additional £1500 in cash per year 
9% pension, 
25% bonus - got full bonus next year
yr end is in march so depending how the job search goes shemay decide to stay until after bonuses have been paid 
looking for min £75k above £80k ideal
3 months notice

contact-comment:
Comments: 09 Mar 2016 15:52 KS:
Nbd needed. Sam emery. 

15 months. Great. IH for whole career - wanted agency experience 

Wants IH:  knows it could take time. Change in industry 

Placement studio at LV, asset mgt PR team start. Broader mar comms work and sponsorship. Transactions. Legg Mason sponsorship. Strong sports sponsorship. Wanted more into PR. Ex us asset mgt at Mellon, resp for PR. Head of inter marketing and corp affairs. Global reach. Great kudos for a London hub role. Asia Pacific - 

Pressure to incorporate comma ultimately. 

Chair of group and sports sponsorship marketing. Got bored of Group and missed business and asset mgt and FS broadly. Boat race sponsorship. Leadership wants role in nyc. Left June 2014. Left end of October 14. 

Knew gay Collins - Head of FS, different challenge. Joined November 14. Leads FS practice within financial practice. £3.5m in revenue, 25 ppl. FS clients. Been change in market anyway. Gavin Devine leaving now. Wants IH for sure. 16 weeks notice. Creativity and multiple clients has been nice but the shift was hard. New business pressure has been good and bad. 

Could take time. Change in FS market impacts 
£170k - if pension is right he would move for same. Currently 6%
Used to 12.5% pension 
Bonus IH was good. Not now at MHP. 

List of asset management firms ideal 
FS in general
Not retail banking 
Insurance 
Fin tech 
Private wealth 
Family office 
A regulated industry rather than non regulated - energy or telco

When the right job comes along. 

List of ppl placed across clients - Hanson search.

contact-comment: Comments: After graduating in Politics at Exeter University, Jon began his career on the campaign staff of the then Social Democratic Party leader Dr David Owen MP. He has worked in business communications since 1987, specialising in corporate and business-to-business PR, issues and crisis management. Formerly a director of The Communication Group plc, he joined FD as a partner in February 2000 and now leads our specialist Issues Management practice, focusing on contentious communications challenges and reputation risks. His client experience has covered a wide range of organisations, large and small, quoted and unquoted, in every sector. He was President of the British Institute of Public Relations in 2002.

contact-comment:
Comments: Scorecard- highlighting whats most important to them
involved significantly since Katie worked for them 

Josephine and her started the agency 3.5 years ago in London to focus on drivers of innovation and economy. Any company that is changing or rethinking their respected industry.

Not necissarily a tech agency but are all linked
Venture Capital, Acell Partners 
investors in so many respected categories- drop box, deliveroo, FS, group on, work closely with their team and as a result work with a lot of companies they've invested in
Blablacar- global leader in ride sharing, grown from 20 to 350 people 
100 million in funding last year, biggest advisors in their internal corporate team, US, UK outreach in germany 
went from journalists saying that sounds rediculous to getting them in the Economist
focus is high growth start-ups, first to market or best in class
Beyond-instagram and google, digital experience 
Deliveroo
Heavy consumer but also heavy corporate, just done some big consumer segments, fund raising announcements, leading global 
IDEO- designing school systems, first lap top, raising their profile in European, Jamie oliver parternership
Trezi- presentation software, visual way to share idea, challenger to powerpoint B2B/Consumer Tech/Thought Leadership
Hotel Search- London based entrepernuirs, rethink how people find hotels, smart technology B2C travel press, B2B and corporate
UK Four Ex- Fin Tech, online and international transfers, IPO, Australian companies, 
out of 8 clients 3 are hardcore consumer 70/30

Agency-
both come from Agency backgrounds- Microsoft, HP, Samsung
Josephine was at a boutique firm aquuired by Grayling- disolutioned by how large agencies do PR, nt focused on clients and commercial objectives
set up an agency that would take a smarter and more focused approach to PR
expertise is PR will go above and beyond when recommedning a campaign and suggest other ways to leverage it. Pretty much all of their clients have strong marketing capabilities and they work closely with the SEO

Strict culture with the clients they will take on board- first to market, real innovators addressing a serious marketing opportunity, global ambition, meaningful investment into PR, inspired by them and actually like them as people.

Eliza and Josephine- Directors
SAM b2c
SAE- about to be promoted to AM b2b
SAE- deep tech background (part time)
2x AE- experience in both corporate and consumer 

Consumer AD 
senior to the SAM, Consumer tech, want to join the agency and be motivated to put best practices in place and shape the consumer offering, consumer clients want to grow and the thing stopping them is their capacity
Would love them to help with new business and service those roles, comfortable and excited to do that, new business is unecissary

Had a freeze on new business since August, anticipate massive growth within the next six months

Team is bright, empathetic, curious, warm, welcoming, ambitious driven and funny
Go out for after work drinks, coctails on Fridays

Recruitment- finding people who are excited by the prospect of working with emerging brands, mid-senior have a lot of candidatres who come in are interested at first but not interested in start-ups
Feedback that they are too small as an agency
Opportunity to shape their culture

never want to be a massive, would love to be about 30/40 people

Working with people who are so fundamental in the shift that's happening in the market

Interview process- 
Josephine and Eliza 
NotesId: 721006-2694-15160


Note: do 1st stage to screen 
2nd- talk through a presentation, ideas, where they can imagine seeing
if they know for sure after 2nd they will make an offer
3rd team to meet them , drinks/tea/depends on schedule

Big believers on work life balace, 6/6.30pm

Salary: 
would look at SAM taking step up
Wary of ones who have been SAM for ages

Agency- Fleishman, Weber Shandwick, Nelson Bostock, Waggener Edstrom, Edelman, Brunswick

Tech or Corporate, understands technology in an excesable way, has tech experience/corporate
adept at telling a good story and built contacts
AM- Corporate/Tech

contact-comment:
Comments: Stephen a 32 ans, 11 ans d’expérience dont 10 ans en agence de publicité chez WFCA où il est en poste aujourd’hui en tant que 
Business Développement Director.
Il commence sa carrière chez McDonald au Marketing où il reste 1 an.
Il rejoint ensuite WFCA (agence de publicité 360˚ indépendante - dans le top 30 des agences aux UK), il commence en tant qu’Account Executive, puis il passe Account Manager et devient au bout de 4 ans Account Director. Il reste à ce poste 3 ans et manage un équipe de 5 personnes. 
Il lead les pitchs et fait les présentations auprès des clients. Il participe à la stratégie et écrit les recommandations.
Apres ces 3 ans, il souhaite de nouveaux challenges et passe Senior Strategic Planeur. Il travaille alors main dans la main avec le directeur du planning 
sur les stratégies de marques.
Il est aujourd’hui et depuis plus d’un an ½ New Business Director. Il gère à l’origine la fusion entre l’agence avec une agence media. 
Il définit les stratégies de développement (key sectors, key clients…). Il peut avoir une approche directe pour trouver de nouveaux clients (même s’il est aidé par une New business manager qui s’occupe des calls). Il rencontre les clients et présente la compagnie. Il sait identifier clairement quelles sont les opportunités (une de ses forces).
Il connaît très bien le marché anglais, il des contacts dans les agences pouvant lui permettre d’ouvrir les portes.
Il sait comment diriger un business et le faire grandir. Il est excellent vendeur, sur de lui et très sympathique.
Sa personnalité est entrepreneuriale et démarrer un business from scratch ne lui fait absolument pas peur (au contraire !). Il comprend les problématiques de marques, il sait avoir un point de vu de planneur. Il a une très bonne connaissance du digital (son agence étant 360˚).
Son salaire est aujourd’hui de £65K en salaire de base (+ voiture, bonus et actions) et ses prétentions sont de £80K en salaire de base.

Il est très intéressé par le poste et le produit et aimerait beaucoup te rencontrer.
Il est a Bristol toute la semaine prochaine mais est disponible pour te voir la semaine du 19 octobre.

Merci de me dire ce que tu penses de ce candidat.

Bien à toi,

Comments: 12 Mar 2015 10:33 AF:
Dear Millie,

It was great to connect just now. As mentioned I was looking to speak to David Richmond as I wanted to introduce a fantastic design candidate to him who is currently on the market. Please see a snapshot of their experience below.

Snapshot Senior Designer:
·	Over 8+ years experience in branding and packaging design at well-known London agencies
·	Clients portfolio include Diageo, Britvic, LVMH, Twinings, Henkel, Kallo, Danone
·	Was in charge of running all global brand communication for Belvedere Vodka 
·	Strategic thinker used to managing a team of 3 juniors as well as two years experience in joint account management

Hanson Search is a headhunting firm in marketing communications space and I specialize in mid- to senior level branding and design positions. We actively approach and connect with the best current talent in the market as well as seek out new opportunities which is why I approached David directly, as my candidate had mentioned R Design as one of their preferred agencies for career development. 

I’d be grateful if you could pass this message on to David and I am keen to get his thoughts on the snapshot above.

Many thanks in advance!

Best regards,
Annette

contact-comment:
Comments: Tequila : André Calisti arrive, Olivier Allardi part
André Calisti, 47 ans, précédemment directeur des ressources humaines chez Ogilvy One, rejoint Tequila (groupe TBWA) au poste de chief operating officer (COO). A ce titre, il prend en charge les RH de l'agence de marketing services et communication digitale (recrutement, formation, politique salariale, plan de carrière et talent management), son organisation et les volets process et qualité. Il reportera directement à Laurent Lilti, président. Ancien professeur de philosophie, André Calisti a été consultant auprès de cabinets ministériels, puis consultant en gestion des conflits auprès des établissements hospitaliers publics et privés. DRH chez debitel pendant dix ans, il a ensuite occupé ces fonctions chez OgilvyOne, où il a parallèlement intégré le comité de direction. Parallèlement et sans rapport de cause à effet, Olivier Allardi, 46 ans, Dg de Tequila, a quitté l'agence. Une décision qui n'est pas unilatérale, mais décidée d'un commun accord, sans conflit identifié entre les deux parties. Olivier Allardi travaille sur plusieurs projets professionnels, l'un autour du contenu, l'autre sur le sujet data/études, un troisième étant en cours de formalisation. Après un début de carrière chez l'annonceur, il a mené sa carrière en agences, successivement chez Rapp Collins (chef de projets), OgilvyOne jusqu'en 2001 (consultant, partner puis directeur commercial), Rapp Collins à nouveau de 2001 à 2005 (directeur commercial puis Dga), DraftFCB de 2005 à 2006 (Dg) et enfin Tequila où il était depuis 2006 Dg, plus particulièrement en charge du commercial.

Comments: Meeting 21/01/2016 JS

New client PepsiCo (have won 6 six October 15)

Dan's first thoughts where to make sure we knew his thoughts on JB and HAnson.  JB was too salesy and agressive, candidates cancelling at late notice or not showing 80% of the time, they were poorly briefed and some he did send he had already had turned down by Dan.

Gave the SenFinPR role to The Foundry, they filled this, likes Lynn Jones as she seems to give him preferential treatment - he wont do retainers (JB pushed this far too often on junior roles) but feels she gives him this treatment without the upfront cost.

Headland Split:
They have one P&L with no split accross CC and FinPR, not pushy with targets its a veryv relaxed atmosphere in that sense, 36 people in total now, a couple of sector specialists but most people are a mix along with FinPR people doing wider CC.

5 senior people in FinPR predom with FS and PS in CC also.  Would look to take in an AM here ath this level, Likes candidates from Fins, Bruns, Tulchan, BR.

Wants PR people to think outside the box in terms of solving a PR issue for a client.  Someone that is Creative (almost like a creative director but within PR), punchy in person, ambitious, creative campaigning in corp.

APPROACH:  Won't look to brief us, we need to prove oourselves once again, softly approach, MAKE SURE CANDIDATES FIT AND SHOW UP! 



Martin Brown gave him a list of 20 recruitment players, saying he’d researched the market at length and I came out on top in terms of quality, market knowledge etc. 

Headland was a 13/14 person hidden away, good quality FS and PS agency. Founded in 2005 - by 2 senior guys (Chris Salt & Howard Lee) from Kreab Gavin Anderson (bit of FPR and CC and M&A, odd IPO) - mainly private equity firms and law firms. 

Dan Mines from Fishburn (built up Fishburn) and left in a big hissy fit in Feb 2011, spent a year in the garden, wanted to bring a new and fresh offer to Finan and Corp PR. Took lots of talented people from Fishburn and Blue Rubicon. Dan Smith (set up Blue Rub) joined and believed in what they were doing. 

Clients: UBS, 

They have been broadening out their corporate work. Large, strong and diverse senior team in place now.

NOT a consumer PR agency - most famous work they have done that for School Food Plan (Nick Clegg’s pushing for free school food) - result of Headland’s work.

Behave as a start up. Digital and content strong.

Moved offices, rebrand, 20 people now, pitching a lot - 10 competitive pitches in last 3 months. Drive the activity of a much larger business. 

Desperate for people - going to meet Dan

contact-comment:
Comments: Spoke to 29.7.14: not looking as had various developments have lept her happy. Always worth listening to opps as 'you never know'. Probably not another agency, probs IH (over next 2-5 years). 

Fprmer jounro for 7 years (personal finance space), then moved into marketing (didnt enjoy marketing side as felt it was a lot of process/logistics and not much intelligence). Then PR - May 2013- joined Cicero. Loves PR. 

Would like to work broader - but she's interested by other areas. Other sectors and clients - charities or responsible investing, ethical side to it. Interested in int'l development, housinjg and property. 

She's personal finance now. Banking, wealth mgt client, regulator, asset mgr

She likes ideas and creativity and campiagning.

new business - does a lot of that. enjoys that - one thing she'd miss that

Lines manages two reports but has a wider role as managing the wider team.

int'l focus: don't deal with many int'l clients - she does a lot of UK and EU focused work. There is one US/Canada focused client. THAT would interest - potentially got an opp to do that

Salary: £50K. Pension, healthcare, bonus: not yet (next 3 weeks), 25 days. 3 mths notice (TBC)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SPOKE TO NICOLA YORK...no for Broadgate Mainland
Doing a 2 years Masters (specialising in Financial Services) atm - started in Sept 14.
Works at Cicero - 4 days per week as a result.
Sector focus was FS but moving away from FS - likes Government or Charitable or CSR 'human' focus. Not looking at moving to another agency in a CC generalist capacity.
Would need be something "compelling" - really wants an IH role.
Sal: on £50k (£40k pro-rata 4 days p/w)
NP: thinks its 2 months (though could be 3 months).
Happy to KIT.

Comments: 13.1.2016
Partnership model - divisional heads. George heads up Corp (FSPS, property). Hugh warrender - Bus development. Former lawyer heading up special situations and disputes. Own p&l, own teams. Partners meeting? Similar to law firm structure. Devolving share options to partners. Group equity. Partners will get dividends. No limit to partners. New Mulberry Marketing head coming on board. 

Really ambitious to build own practice. Future ownership 

Associates. Transparent and open about progression. Bring in clients - 3+ clients and you're a partner

Very wealthy hedge funds, private companies, trusted advisor. Top of milk round food chain. Ambitious driven central London career. Wants to be a team worker. Relishes current affairs. 

Ppl: 15 
£1.6m in 2015 revenue 
£2.2m target for 2016
Charlie wants to run his own practice ultimately 

Really bright ppl with the right work ethic. Alpha

Challenging, fun, driven, energetic, hard working, dedicated, c-suite capable

Splits: 3 in George's team, 2 under Victoria's new Mulberry hire) luxury, Hugh has 2 under him, Patrick is solo. One person in Oxfordshire - head of dyson previously....tech person - companies they can target in Reading constituency. Corynn...3 days a week 

Towards Thames valley - oxfordshire, reading, Berkshire 

No one under 25. 2nd level career wise  

Consultant title: David butler (luxury)
Associate: group profit share at lower level (5% profit after cost -£8/9k per person) Plus Discretionary performance bonus 
Min fee level is high (not less than £5k per month). Less accounts per person.

BYT - need. Creating a learning culture and thirsty for knowledge. Learn from a mixed back of ppl. 
Share salary survey

Not just traditional media relations - much more about helping client to achieve strategic objectives! BD/ Investment/ Digital etc

contact-comment:
Comments: 
<http://beauty.dior.com/fra/fr/woman/woman-fragrance/layout-fullscreen/miss-dior-cherie.html>
http://beauty.dior.com/fra/fr/base.html#/fr/dior.html?event=40.614 <http://beauty.dior.com/fra/fr/base.html>
<http://www.giorgioarmanibeauty.com/_int/_en/inspiration/ead-for-men/ead-for-men.aspx>
<http://www.mickeymagicalyear.com/idf/?ctag=FR&ltag=FRL>
<http://www.shuuemuraartofhair.com/_fr/_ww/home.aspx>

Et mon projet personnel (adresse de développement)
<http://wip.shaperstudio.com/cpluv/com/public/>

Christophe a 14 ans d’expérience et un profil très digital. Après avoir été free-lance, DA chez Union Dream (plateforme e-commerce) et chez Capgemini avec la casquette de consultant nouveaux media, Christophe est depuis 3,5 ans Directeur de Création chez Publicis Net. Il manage entre 30 et 35 personnes. Il peut intervenir seul ou en tant que Co-DC avec Philippe Simonet sur d’autres problématiques.
Il fait de la conception artistique et de la rédaction, il n’hésite pas à mettre la main à la pâte ; il aime trouver les idées, notamment sur les gros sujets d’architecture ou de dispositif social.
Il sait rentrer dans la technique (il travaille sur un projet personnel qui est un lourd projet de développement).
Il est excellent créatif, il connait et sait mettre en œuvre tout ce qui est à la pointe du digital. Il a géré de nombreux très beaux projets tels que la refonte du site Miss Dior Chérie (Lion d’Or à Cannes cette année) ; le site Armani en 3D (il en a supervisé toute la production) ; Disney « Toonification » ; Orange ; Garnier…
Il a un très bon contact client et sait gérer les clients difficiles.
Il travaille aujourd’hui au 4/5 (il donne des cours aux dernières années à Olivier de Serres et en Suisse à Genève dans une école de création).
Le challenge d’MRM l’intéresse et il serait ravi de vous rencontrer

contact-comment:
Comments: Petra joined Grayling Croatia in 2006 from a background in Government public relations, previously being communications assistant at the Ministry of Environmental Protection, Physical Planning and Construction in Croatia for the period of 2.5 years. She started her career path working for the Croatian Medical and Biological Engineering Society as well as International Federation of Medical and Biological Engineers.

Before joining Grayling team in Qatar in January 2013 as a member of the senior management team and Head of Healthcare for META region she held a position of Country Manager Serbia and Client Services Director of South-East Europe.

Petra has extensive experience in development, coordination and implementation of communications strategies, including awareness campaigns, HCPs outreach, reimbursement campaigns, crisis communication and CSR. During her eight years with Grayling, Petra’s healthcare sector experience includes National Health Insurance Company (Qatar), World Innovation Summit for Health (WISH), Sanofi, Medtronic, PharmaSwiss (Eli Lilly), Schering Plough, GSK, MEDA Pharmaceuticals, Novo Nordisk and Johnson&Johnson Devices.

Since moving to META region Petra has lead key clients including Hamad International Airport, Al Jazeera Children's Channel, QMDI, while in SEE region Petra’s client portfolio included leading multinationals such as Samsung, Mars, Hilton, British Airways, Qatar Airways, DT, Henkel, Discovery Networks, Rio Tinto, Coca-Cola HBC, etc

Petra was responsible for CSR project “Our beautiful Sava” developed and implemented with Coca Cola which won European Excellence Award 2009. In addition, international project developed and implemented for Chevrolet on 11 Grayling markets and coordinated by Petra was shortlisted for IPRA Golden World Award 2011.

contact-comment:
Comments: M&C Saatchi PR is an agency in its ascendancy and I have joined the team in London to help build on their strengths as well as expand the offering internationally.

M&C Saatchi PR is a full service consumer and business to business public relations consultancy.

We have an award winning team of PR consultants and a client list that includes some of the UK’s biggest brands including Dixons, twitter, EE, Spotify, Travelex and Ocado.

Our specialisms include retail, mobile & telecomms, consumer technology, food & drink, personal finance, entertainment, social media & digital relations, fashion & beauty, small business, corporate & trade.

We have four core areas of focus across our business; consumer marketing, Corporate & B2B brand reputation management, events & experiential and digital & design.

We are located on Golden Square in Soho, London.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Gavin, Managing Director of Bell Pottinger’s Financial and Corporate business, has extensive experience advising clients on complex communications challenges and managing cross border teams and programmes. He advises a wide portfolio of clients on strategic positioning and reputation management, M&A; both hostile and defence, IPOs, trade sales and general senior management counsel. Gavin works with both listed and non-listed clients including TPG, Suzuki Motor Corporation and the Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan. He also advises the chief executives of Iglo Group, Premier Oil and Hays. Major transactions include advising the first ever restructuring and sale of a Commercial Mortgage Backed Security (CMBS); the €1.1bn Uni-Invest real estate portfolio and the acquisition of the £1bn+ Lundy portfolio from Lloyds Banking Group.

contact-comment:
Comments: Take children from all over the country - want to be seen on an international level alongside Boston, GOSH and Melbourne. Currently seen as a much loved local hospital. Very different to GOSH and they have much of a family feel and have a lot of football chat, cleaners hugging people on the corridor. 

The move to the new hospital. Put the whole organ scandal thing to bed, was seen as the being at the forefront, had a big reputational impact, all really been put to bed now. In terms of public perception its very good. 

The public park is being built and the new hospital, the current hospital is being designed by children, all roofs will have grass son them, hoping to grown their own food with local enterprises.

Got some agreements with BT, Sony etc to partner with them on innovation. Every child will be given a tablet, they will create an avatar will then guide round the hospital, can ask the consultant questions and order chefs. 

75% of beds are single rooms with a parent bed in their too. They will have a digital wall where they can create their own wall. 

This will be the first time ever they can get into BA magazine, NY times, broadsheets. 

She has been there 18 months - she wants to leave around Easter time - wants to find someone that can do wonders with it. There are issues around naivety around finding good comms people and what they cost. Working on the 

Permanent basis - 8/9 in the team, 1 on short term contract. There is a Head of Comms - does all line management of all staff (comes from Health and safety executive, career civil servant) 
Marketing and Communications Director - very heavily PR led comms role. They don’t really do marketing - do Marcomms piece - not technical marketing. There is a BD Associate Director. 
The Trust is the contract and pay 60% of the salary - 40% of the budget comes from the charity. They work alongside each other - charity has some fundraising responsibility and reputation is all the same. 

Person who left was on £120k - but they reduced the role to £80k. But that hasn’t worked. 

Healthcare experience would be great - but not essential. Very open on background - there is a brand piece that needs developing. 

The people on the executive

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Spoke to Rowland - all going ok at M&C. Been there 4 months & still on 1 wk np (in prob). A few things to iron out & uncertainites for LT @ M&C. Still open to ops. V keen on WB PR Part role. Sent spec & CV en route.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spoke to 28.7.14: done CC, crisis, rep mgt.

At IHS (in house - snr mgr, comms) - always dealing with challenging issues. Defence, geo politics, world economics teams - always running into challenges. Busy press office - dealing with broadcast interviews per day. Research and analytics company. Loved it at IHA but it wasnt going to turn into more challenges unless moves to HQ in Denver. He quit and both bosses understood. Only press office so would only go so far. 

Moved from Golin to try IH side. IHS had been a client at ogilvy. 

Before that at Golin Harris - crisis comms involved: concerning the supply of baby milk formula across Europe; helping one of the largest global FMCGs to identify potential risks and train key leaders globally to manage them; mitigating against local stakeholder activism for one of the largest natural gas storage facilities in the UK; helping a cosmetics company to manage product recalls and customer complaints; helping a consulting company reduce risks to the safety of personnel (amid action from a terrorist group) and protecting intellectual property (in the midst of an IT breach); protecting the world’s largest production company amid the ‘phone-in-scandal’; and managing day to day risk response for retained clients at Hill & Knowlton, Ogilvy and GolinHarris. 

At H&K before that. Worked gambling/casinos. Liked it there and learnt a lot. Learnt more from the PA team (adjacent to him) than he did from the CC team. Liked energy client and casino client. Gazprom client. Worked with Rod Cartwright - mtg him next week

He's broader CC, done some int comms. Likes meaty issues, challenges and issues-rich topics. Interested in energy as a sector but he's open. 

Looking for freelance or perm, IH or agency. Crisis appeals as it's something to chew on. 

Where has he been? - mtg Rod Cartwright at Ketchum, chatting to listed insurance company, academic/research organisation ints in October, intw with Uber tomorrow (29.7.14), CVs gone to Nelson Bostock (thru recruiter)

Salary: On £75K - but the roles he's been lkg at have been £60-98K. Open to title. 

Ogilvy, H&K - yes
Golin Harris - no

He would dearly love to have a conversation with Tim Luckett at H&K. He will leave it with me to introduce as knows I mentioned it to him.

sending me less crisis-focused 

Ideally he would start a new job in 1-2 months

contact-comment:
Comments: PUBLIC RELATIONS AND COMMUNCIATIONS IN DUBAI, THE UAE AND BEYOND

Blue Rubicon is an award-winning strategic communications and public relations consultancy, specialising in reputation management. We serve leading brands, companies and governments, securing their success. 
We have a long-term understanding of the United Arab Emirates and the broader region, having worked here since 2005. Our team in Dubai combines an international view of communications with deep experience of the Middle East.
From Dubai our consultants also serve clients in Abu Dhabi, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and elsewhere in the region.
Blue Rubicon was founded in London in 1999, and also has offices in Doha and Singapore.
In Dubai, Blue Rubicon specialises in: 
—   Protecting and growing reputations to build trust and drive growth – we advise in the boardrooms of the world’s biggest corporations, brands and governments
—   Developing and implementing compelling communications strategies and narratives that achieve results
—   Achieving the media profiles organisations deserve
—   Bringing strategic clarity in a digital world
—   Helping organisations positively influence the behaviour of staff, customers, citizens and residents through campaigns based on an understanding of why people act the way they do
—   Corporate social responsibility campaigning (CSR)
—   Managing difficult reputational challenges and turn crises into reputational opportunities
—   Winning hearts and minds for energy and infrastructure projects
—   Providing best-in-class coaching for leaders, including media training and social media training
OUR CLIENTS

Our clients in and from Dubai have included:
—   Basrah Gas Company
—   Foreign and Commonwealth Office (UK Government)
—   Herman Miller
—   Heathrow
—   GE
—   Rolls-Royce
—   Shell
—   Sharjah Chamber of Commerce
—   Virgin Mobile Saudi Arabia
 

WE OFFER AWARD-WINNING STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS

Blue Rubicon provides visionary communications for businesses, for governments, and for leaders. We create competitive positioning, narrative and messaging and deliver creative campaigns. Our approach to PR and corporate reputation management is audience-led and based on insight.
We are focused on merging the best global thinking with a deep understanding of the history and culture of the region. Our aim is to provide communications that bring to life the vision of clients in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Riyadh, Jeddah, Basrah or elsewhere in the region to the same standard as they would expect in London.
Blue Rubicon offers something genuinely different for both clients and talent in the UAE, characterised by the quality and innovation of our work.

contact-comment:
Comments: Chatted 21.5.14:

One year at Cognito now. SAM. First agency role. Wrkd at Barlcays for a year straight out of Uni (Banking/mortghage side). Then National Australia Bank (mortgages - got into marketing then) - did marketing for 3.5 years there. 

PR role came up at Nat Aus Bank and did that for a year. Then Standared Chartered in their Corp PR team in London - 3 years - results, corp announcements, CFO/CEO mgt of inerviews, running sustainability programmes.

Fancied a move into agency after 10 years IH. Was introduced to London MD at Cognito. 

Clients now: Bloomberg, Swift, CME Group, Mysis (fin tech provider) - broad experience - FS and fin tech. Messaging, writing, product work

Said he would give it a year at Cognito - he enjoys it but not sure ultimately they are the right agency. Likes of Finsbury and Maitland (corp and FTSE100 is more his background). But saying that, he's getting good experience. Not lkg to jump into another agency role but will listen to it. decent IH role would get him thinking about it seriously.

£52,500 base. Bonus paid out: £got half years bonus (10%). 1 month notice. SAM title

contact-comment:
Comments: AG and JE met James at London Bridge 29/07/2015

- The company is likely to be split into a Munro & Forster Health offer and Munro & Forster general brand. 
- He is considering options as there is some uncertainty about the financials and expectations on what he would have to deliver to keep things going there in the new entity and red tape around it.
- keen on FTI in particular as it fits what he wants (bigger agency and interesting brands which would be good for a future director of comms type role). Tonic Life is also interesting similar to what he is doing now but for more money. 
- salary: wants £100k+
- on holiday from 12 Aug until 26th Aug. 


JE Intv 27/01/15

Been at Munro for 10 years - wa sin early on the PA team and now leads that area
Majority of work is in healthcare 
They do health and govt as an agency but he is health specialist
Billed £650,000 last year in PA
His team is 2 x Ads, 2x AEs, 1x chairman
Clients; Lumbeck, Jansen, Roche diagnostics, lore, charities
Starting to do more pr personally - consumer pr - is enjoying the mix
Vitamin D campaign 
20-22 people total in Munro
Client work most the time with his role - New business is great and he really enjoys this 
2 x shareholders that own the business
They have talked to him about getting shares but it has never really happened and getting increasinly frustrated with this

contact-comment:
Comments: Le directeur des stratégies/directeur conseil, Julien, a 33 ans, 10 ans d’expérience en agence web, et travaille aujourd’hui et depuis 7 ans chez TBWA Interactive. 
Il a débuté sa carrière chez Connectworld (1ere agence Internet du groupe Havas, crée par le patron actuel de Duke). Il a eu beaucoup de responsabilités très rapidement.
Il y reste 2 ans et avant d’intégrer TBWA Interactive et d’y développer le pôle conseil. Apres 1 an, il devient responsable du planning stratégique et travaille soit pour ses propres clients, soit pour les clients du groupe en transversal quand l’un d’eux a besoin de digital.
Depuis 4 ans, il est directeurs des stratégies et intervient en tant que directeur conseil sur certaines marques (Leroy Merlin, la Redoute…).
Il a une vraie mission consulting car il y a encore beaucoup de clients qui ont peu de connaissance en digital, il les forme et les accompagne sur les enjeux d’Internet. 
Il a en charge le planning et c’est à lui que revient de trouver le bon levier pour toucher le consommateur, de trouver une idée pour la marque. Il est aussi responsable new biz 
(il fait du new biz depuis 9 ans) et fait également partie du comité de direction de TBWA Interactive.
Il souhaite s’orienter aujourd’hui vers un rôle avec un aspect commercial plus fort, il est donc très intéressé par le poste de directeur conseil au sein de votre agence.
Julien est quelqu’un qui sait être très à l’écoute du client et très rassurant (il arrive très bien à aider et conseiller le client sur ce qui est bien ou pas pour lui). 
Il est très à l’aise en management. Il possède un excellent réseau agences et annonceurs.
Il passe en ce moment des entretiens, notamment chez Digitas.
Son salaire est de 84 K€ + intéressement et participation.

contact-comment:
Comments: 29 Oct 2014 14:59 JB:

Broadgate mainland 

SAM and AD 
Tend to loose people to Inhouse not other agencies 

24 people in total 
Stagnating in turnover - plateau 
Just won two new contracts - f/y starts 1st Nov 
Got lots of leads coming through they cherry pick the ones to focus on

ADS - drive the strategy in clients a stet involved in presenting due new business
Associate/Director level plus have that financial target 

New clients; Woodford, came from relationship with Paul
Euro money
Useb group 
Hargreaves hail 
Old mutual 
90% is retained still 
50% of clients have been with them over 5 years - have annual review meetings - Roland would attend 

10% higher education - university of Westminster, Durham university, doing the whole piece across consumer 
10% professional services team
80% financial services 

Put staff through IMC 
Keep people informed quarterly about company developments 

Competitors; MRM, Lansons, capital MSL, FTI, Bell Potts 
Run a matrix system - don't work in silos 
Do digital for part and parcel as part of their work

3 agencies - they have put it out to
Contingent or retained terms 

AD - take the strategy 
New client- what the kpus are, setup account, run the client 
Financial services 
3-6 months out abs looking at strategic side 
Smaller £3k they would run, 

Mngt board - smt
ADs run the staff forum - get together monthly to feedback - help shape the business 
Want to progress people 
Associate director - get potential share options 
Salaries are competitive 
Spot bonus on creds opens 

Hire grads as accounts assistant 
6 x AEs
6 x AMs
2 x ADs
6 x exec board 
New Role; Bailey Gifford, Woodford, Swiss & global 

Some Inhouse previously
Email over T and C's
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Note about Roland Cross from Broadgate Mainland website:

Roland Cross, Director, has twenty three years’ experience in public relations and founded Broadgate in 1994. He has worked across many high-profile PR campaigns in the financial sector ranging from corporate activity to split capital investment trusts. 
With extensive knowledge of PR across investment management, hedge funds, pensions, banking and the offshore market, Roland is also experienced in handling corporate and financial activities including IPOs, M&A transactions and crisis management.
Following an early career in banking with Mellon Bank, Roland’s initial training in financial PR was with Barnfather Associates where he worked on a variety of blue chip accounts.

Favourite expression: “Always look on the bright side of life!” 
Mastermind topic: Chelsea FC managers! 
Guilty secret: Enjoying a day at the cricket under the guise of work.
You wouldn’t know it but I am surprisingly good at: I’m brilliant at ski jumping - on the Wii.

Comments: Dear Rutger,

Thank you for time earlier today. As mentioned Hanson Search is a headhunting firm and our side of the team specialise in the strategy design and branding space, which is why I wanted to introduce you to a great candidate who I am currently working with as they expressed an interest in opportunities at Anthem:  

Mid-weight Designer Snapshot: 
·	Over 5 years packaging experience in-house at Unilever and agency side 
·	Strong fmcg background -  worked with diverse clients such as Speedo, Crispy Creme, Dove, Tigi, Britvic
·	Passionate about brand strategy and consumer insights
·	Very collaborative and facilitates internal idea sharing


I appreciate you are currently not looking for new candidates in this instant, so it would be great to have a catch up in a couple of weeks’ time to introduce myself and our services further to see how we can add value to your team. How about we reconnect  on the 18th of March in a short call to arrange a meeting nearer the time?

Looking forward to hearing from you.
Kind regards,
Annette

contact-comment:
Comments: Nic began his career at investment bank Schroders after graduating from Cambridge University. He first joined FD in 1988 and rejoined in 1995 after a period working in-house at investment bank BZW. He now heads up FD’s Transactions team, focusing on M&A, international capital markets issues and special situations. 

Recent work includes Harmony Gold Mines’ (South Africa) hostile bid for Gold Fields (South Africa); Aventis’ (France) defence against Sanofi-Synthelabo (France); GE Real Estate’s contested bid for Sophia (France); Carnival Corporation’s (US) contested bid for P&O Princess Cruises (UK); the auction of Liffe (UK) (ultimately won by French company Euronext); Vinci’s (France) hostile bid for TBI (UK); British Energy’s financial restructuring; the launch and ongoing PR for Freddie Mac’s (US); annual EUR 20bn euroReference note programme; crisis management for Cap Gemini (France); the combination of Equant, Global One, and France Telecom (France); Vodafone’s hostile bid for Mannesmann (Germany); the proposed merger of Alcan (Canada), Pechiney (France) and algroup (Switzerland); and the merger of British Steel and Hoogovens (Netherlands) to form Corus.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
David Shriver - Managing Partner
dshriver@tulchangroup.com
+44 (0) 20 7353 4200

I joined Tulchan in 2009 and can honestly say I would have joined no other consultancy. The firm has a truly exceptional concentration of quality people and is using its talent, together with its specialist and collaborative approach, to provide clients with unparalleled strategic communications advice and guidance. By committing to a thorough understanding of our clients’ businesses and their aspirations we are able to help them convey their story to their various audiences.

I believe that Tulchan is genuinely different. Our business model has been developed to meet the needs of clients in an information-rich but time-poor world, where positive, challenging and creative advice can help deliver better results. My role as Managing Partner, in addition to my client work, will be to manage and grow the firm and ensure that Tulchan delivers the best possible service to its clients.

contact-comment:
Comments: 26 Oct 2016 10:47 AmirH:

Work they're doing:
Oncology work w/ novartis 
Roche MS
Vaccines work too 
Focus is UK - global work is probably too boring 
NHS - possibly kings college work coming up but the budgets are too small
Iron and anaemia testing work with the NHS at the moment
Oncology for novartis (acc which frustrates GF the most because they can't make decisions - so bureaucratic)


Leadership:
Pat (Pearson) is very creative, always coming with whacky new ideas even though he doesn't seem the type
Paul has grown a bit tired of it all and wanted to take a step back, they both agreed that was for the best but 
Grant said that previously they have been on better terms than they are now
Currently doing some leadership coaching with the exec team because Paul and Pat want the exec team 
to point the company in the right direction - Grant was suspiscious about how long firstlight would remain indie 
cos of Pat possibly wanting to sell up


Rec Needs:
Between MD and Associate Director is the space they're trying to fill (so between Pat and Grant)
Need more AccDr/SnrAccDr/Associate 
Part timers might be okay 
Job share is not an option - grant thinks it doesnt work
he tends to source his own freelancers (large network) 
Would meet ADs or SADs who come from multi-practic globally 
Six to Nine months into an AE or JAE 
- not fresh grads: they do see the big agencies as a training ground 


The Sell:
Flat structure, not hierarchical
Have a business plan to become the exclusive agency who doesn't have to pitch 
Want to work on all the interesting stuff (public health, infectious diseases, corporate, mental) 
Doing a workshop about HIV and what they do with them 
Launch for Roche next year (invest loads in r&d) MS drug coming out next year FL doing some cool things around the launch (immersive theatre - taking people from room to room to show them what having MS is like) 
Anaemia work is quite interesting 
Policy stuff that they're doing is quite interesting 
People listen at Firstlight - cos of flat structure they have an open forum for new ideas
Not about numbers and profits and turn over, it's about the work and having fun with it 
Really good work/life balance = 9-5.30 working hours
Latest Grant has stayed in the office was 6.15 
Training programs to fast track staff development 

Benefits - are they having a revamp soon??
Pay is great and above average (38-39k as an SAM)
Youngsters - financial benefits for young people in London and there's a bonus scheme which incorporates a thirteen month salary 
Pension is 4/5% (non-contributory, but you can contribute if you like) 
Birthdays off - Champagne birthdays 
Weekend away is expensive with 27 ppl 
Promotions - Grant manages four AMs - if you're good enough you get promoted (three promotions in last six month) 
Self starter who take responsibility for their own work loads, thinking differently and being innovative 
Summer working hours on Fridays and maybe introducing them during the day too


Good people at FL and elsewhere:
Ruder Finn - Jess Lowry / Kristen Barratt freelancing with Firstlight / Christian placed - doing well (SAm) / Tatiana from Cohn and Wolfe has joined / 
Danielle at Firstlight with Neuroscience degree went to Roche and was teaching their doctors things 
The London clinic - Peter Donnelly (doing some interesting stuff) Put them in touch
David West - golden boy at Roche - his boss is off to Switzerland and so he's probs earmarked for that
Richard @ Golin is looking at the m
NotesId: 738351-5629-16300


Note: oment 

Other info:
Corporate side of FL is very pr and media 
Gilead - 36b income - 18b profit 
Comeandhireme.com

Comments: Madame Christine Chauvet est nommée Senior Counselor d'Apco France (Apco Worldwide). 
Christine Chauvet, 57 ans, licence en histoire de l'art et en archéologie, diplôme de gestion, a réalisé le parcours suivant : * Depuis 2003 : Compagnie nationale du Rhône, président du conseil de surveillance. 
* 2001-2003 : Fleishman-Hillard France, président-directeur général. 
* Depuis 1998 : Conseil économique et social de la région Ile-de-France, vice-président. 
* 1998-2002 : Démocratie libérale, déléguée nationale et membre du bureau politique. 
* 1996-1997 : Centre français du commerce extérieur (CFCE), directeur général. 
* 1995-1996 : Secrétaire d'Etat chargé du Commerce extérieur (gouvernement d'Alain Juppé). 
* 1982-1995 : Conseil économique et social de la région Ile-de-France, membre. 
* 1992-1995 : Association des femmes chefs d'entreprises, président national. 
* 1980-1995 : Association des femmes chefs d'entreprises de l'Ile-de-France, président. 
* 1977-1995 : Approce, directeur. 
* 1973-1995 : Publi 10, rédacteur en chef. 
* 1973-1995 : Chauvet international, directeur.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Teresa Wincrantz
ASSOCIATE PARTNER

Teresa has nearly a decade’s experience of corporate and financial communications and IR, both from agencies and in-house functions.
Prior to joining Chandos, she was a Director at CNC Communications and prior to that she held senior roles at M: Communications and Brunswick. Having started her career at Brunswick Group in 2006 she has worked across several geographies, being based in both Europe and the Middle East.

Teresa has advised international companies across multiple sectors. She has strong experience in leading multi-market projects and has held the overall responsibilities for managing client accounts with complex communications challenges, providing strategic input and overall communications advisory and well as financial and corporate media relations. Teresa has worked with clients on a wide range of transactions including IPOs and cross-border M&A as well as critical communications issues and strategic media and investor relations, crisis situations and corporate profile raisings.








For specs:
·	Currently a Senior Consultant at M:Communciations (AssD/Dir level)
·	Over seven years of corporate and financial communications and IR, including agency and in-house functions, advising large cap Nordic and international companies as well as driving new business programmes
·	Retained clients primarily within financial, luxury and property sectors (e.g. UniCredit Group, LVHM and Prologis). Recent project work includes the merger between Aldar and Sorouh, Abu Dhabi’s largest property developers
·	Prior to M: Communications, she worked at Shared Value leading the firm’s Nordic practice and was responsible for driving new business initiatives 
·	She spent five years previously at Brunswick developing and implementing strategic communications plans for cross-border mergers, crisis situations and management changes as well as proactive media campaigns

contact-comment:
Comments: Patrick Dacquin diplômé de l’Ecole des Arts Appliqués aux Métiers de la Publicité (Corvisart - Paris), 
école de références dans les métiers de la publicité et de l’édition.

Depuis 2010, il est Directeur de Création du compte RENAULT chez DIGITAS France (encadrant une équipe de 20 créatifs). Il manage la conception créative pour le compte du leader français du secteur automobile notamment pour le lancement digital natif de la gamme 100% électrique RENAULT Z.E. 

De 2000 à 2009, il rejoint le studio créatif de BUSINESS INTERACTIF. 
Lors de cette période, il a occupé les fonctions de Digital Creative Copywriter pour le compte de 
LANCÔME, AIRBUS, NESTLÉ, 
IOC (International Olympic Commity), 
EDF, FNAC (PPR group), 
NESTLÉ Brands, 
UNIVERSAL MUSIC MOBILE (3 fois primé), 
SOCIÉTÉ GÉNÉRALE, 
Groupe SEB brands (3 fois primé), 
CANAL+ VOD site marketing,
NISSAN (3 fois primé),
et un grand nombre de compte de l’Agence en encadrant le pôle de Conception Rédaction.

De 1994 à 1999, 
il occupe le poste de Concepteur Rédacteur chez Who’s Partner Agency. 
Il y a créé des campagnes pour 
The Coca-Cola Company, 
Air-Liquide, 
Coliposte, 
R.C.I. (Renault Crédit International) 
et L’Oréal (MD & Trade Marketing).

En 1991, après un début de carrier à la Cooperative de Création, 
il rejoint ALM (Agence Louise-Marie), Agence de Marketing Direct à Paris. 
Il y a créé des campagnes pour 
Mercedes, 
UNILEVER Brands, 
et Aerospatiale (Communication Corporate).


Creative Director and Consulting and digital creative conception :
...........................................................................................

En 2006, Patrick est intervenant en tant que consultant créatif pour CHANEL Beauty et a conçu le site de lancement Rouge Allure.
En 2008, il a conçut l’identité de marque et la stratégie éditoriale de VITALIA (Blackstone Group), le second Groupe foncier hospitalier français.

We are renowned for keeping a very consistent and stable client portfolio with almost zero churn. We are the fastest growing financial PR firm in the country today.

contact-comment:
Comments: NDSE meeting with Anthony Ferdinand 3.5.16 
He's sending us additional info

First 20 ppl in place, serviced office, head of HR, first transaction is £1.8bn transaction - ahead of the game. Unicharged - form a debt financing 
Location: 33 St James Square and 78 Pall Mall 
Bulge bracket Comps: Nomurra, Barclays capital, Goldman Sachs, standard chartered, hsbc

Mid market to large transaction. Boutique investment banks are more common.  
Lots of lay offs 
40-45 ppl across global banking, cap markets 
Older the better, 30 years experience isn't an issue 

Boutique target companies: Green hill (boutique inv bankers), centre view partners (premium investment bankers), harbour vest, Weinberg Parella, Moleis, William Blair, ever core, Storm Harbour

7k lay offs in London alone in investment banking 

Anthony: law background, loved private equity investments, Allen & Overy started out. Wanted to do his own thing. 3 years to grow his team to where it is today

33 Square: early autumn main office is ready

Reporting to Roland Simon. Crisis level: Anthony will get involved 

Interview process: Anthony, Roland, Simon, Gary from HR

Manage up & down, RNS understanding, dealing with the Stock Exchanfe team, regulatory support, someone who wants smaller/not biding time till they are recruiting again, wants to keep it medium sized

Plans: 185 in London, 25-50 in HK, 50 in Paris, 100 in NYC

Timing: 6 transactions until end of year. Want this person in place by second transaction. Work with Lansons on first transaction. 

Entertainment finance space has decreased - Merrill.  lynch, Bank of Ire, RBS, Deutsche Bank. 20% of overall revenues ultimately. Sees it as a massive space. Eg Marvell 

4 divisions:
*Global cap mkts: biggest in size. 24 ppl. Simon Powelly heading dept. 12 analysts and 12 traders. 40% of overall revenue 
* Investment banking. Headed by Roland Bartsch. 
* 
*

Wait until in serviced office w/c 23rd May. 

Camilla - to sign contracts

contact-comment:
Comments: Is 100% Qual, almost no quant. Has been responsible for developing Qual offering alongside very strong Quant teams in businesses that are known for Quant.

Experience had been marketing focussed - helping brands understand their space and consumers/customers to deliver stronger communications and branding solutions. Has international research experience and uses his language skills to add a cultural layer of meaning to his research, giving it stronger resonance in the market.

Strengths: taking complex ideas and presenting them in uncomplicated and succinct ways. Spots commercial opportunities. Enjoys client development, cross selling and intellectual challenge of pitching for new business.

Does not do cold calling - will follow up endlessly on warm leads though.

Very relationship driven. Enjoys being able to create a name for himself. Go to person. Lots of clients seem to enjoy dealing directly with him. 

Current start up opportunity hasn’t had the investment it has needed for him to grow the offering. Is doing a lot of the research himself, too hands on for him to focus on growth. MD is not creating a supportive environment for growth.

Interested in smaller businesses where he can grow the offering and best utilise his skills.

Interested in Optimal and Clear. Had an offer from Flamingo when was moving back from US. They pulled it - wouldn’t consider them again.

Camden based.
1hr travel.
on £70K - no bonus, not additional benefits.

Is keen on having some normal benefits.

£70-80K.

Nice guy

contact-comment:
Comments: Overview
-	Paul has more than twenty years’ experience in primary market research and was most recently Key Account Director at YouGov looking after clients like ITV, Channel 4 and News UK. 
-	Before his eight years at YouGov, Paul spent two years with Synovate as head of a team of five quant researchers working with clients like Barclays, Mastercard and Nokia.
-	He has extensive quantitative experience and is fully adept across methodologies like conjoint, pricing and segmentation.
-	Track record of proven results working across multiple industries including media, social, government, pharma, telecoms and entertainment/leisure. 
-	Global experience having worked both domestically and gained global experience across MENA region.
-	Actively looking for permanent opportunities. 

06 Feb 2017 10:23 AmirH:

Interests: Man Utd fan, Mark Kermode fan, lovely interesting guy
PLEASURE POINTS
- Hands on research
- Likes the process of the research: wnats a challenging role where he learns new things
- Positiive environment
- Embrace new tech 
- Likes a strategic element to his role

Was in the mix for an Insight IDrceotr role at Fetch / RD @ RedBlue

Would prefer a lower basic and commission opportunities than high basic and no commission


YouGov - offered redployment
Package wasn’t great
Role he had been doing looking after ITV and News UK, channel 4
Standard project management and client management 
Had run his course there, there was nowhere for him to go anymore 
Considerable amount of BD as well 
Primarily a quant researcher
Baghdad - Running a lot of focus groups 
8,000 face-face interviews each month 
Split between an opinion tracker and cut through advertising, impacts on particular types of advertising  - as part of that process you would test the storyboards - 
Left YouGOv - left end of Nov 2013 - 8 years working in that region - so decided to come back to the UK - left Dubai office and wasn’t until Apr14 joined Ldn office - they were looking for someone who was account managi8ng 

Synovate - Dubai, moved away from doing media research - newspaper, radio, tv research - then did a couple of little pharma - ME Gel, focus on getting into the media biz cos that was owned by IPSOS at the time 
Managed to set up a different stream of media, about consultancy rather than data, also did automotive, financial, FMCG, employee research, very large project with Nokia across North Africa, 
The way they displayed Nokia advertising in the shops 

Has a huge amount of experience with his methodologies, feels very comfortable with it all 
He was v lucky when he started and he started in an environment which was face to face at the time
So doesn’t matter what sector, the actual getting the bones of the research done, the only issue is when you interpret that data - when he went to Baghdad he didn’t know anything about Islam and by the time he left he knew everything 

3 jobs since October have come and gone 
One was pure BD - didn’t go for that one 
Would like a mix 

Lives in Brighton - 
72k + other benefits (pension, right to work, season ticket loan) 

22 year old girl who has just left uni and a 6 yo boy (who has chicken pox at the moment)
His wife had health problems for a long time due to clinicla negligence and as a result there was a long time between their first and second child

contact-comment:
Comments: Antoine WEIL dispose d'une expérience de 30 ans dans l'industrie et les services. Il est un expert du secteur des nouvelles technologies et des télécommunications. 

Après avoir exercé différents postes au sein de grands groupes de télécommunications comme Thomson, Nortel Telecom et ITT, Antoine WEIL a été entre 1997 et 2003, le Délégué général du Groupement des entreprises françaises d'équipement des télécommunications (GITEP puis GITEP TICS). Il a, à ce titre, participé activement à l’élaboration du cadre réglementaire français et européen des télécommunications. 

Antoine WEIL est le président de l'Institut de Recherche Economiques et Sociales sur les Télécommunications (IREST), le 1er think tank français dédié au secteur des télécommunications.

Antoine WEIL est par ailleurs Président de l'Association des Ingénieurs de l'Institut National Polytechnique de Grenoble, administrateur de l'Agence Nationale des Fréquences, administrateur de l'Institut National Polytechnique de Grenoble, administrateur de la Société de l'Electricité, de l'Electronique et des Technologies de l'Information et de la Communication, conseiller au Comité National des Conseillers du Commerce Extérieur de la France, membre de la Commission Consultative des Réseaux et Services de Télécommunications.

Antoine WEIL est chevalier dans l’Ordre national de la Légion d’Honneur.

JE and AW

Seven hills 
Kathryn Sewell

Growth summit - 300 people

4 x directors plus owners 
Small

Events,

Team lunch sand drinks good and social side

contact-comment:
Comments: SUMMARY

I have diligently served London's international financial services community for a decade. Major client wins include securing changes to UK legislation in the areas of pensions, insurance and road safety - banning the use of hand-held mobile phones when driving! - as well as amendments to EU securities legislation in MIFID and the Prospectus Directive. Currently working hard to develop Cicero's international footprint throughout the European Union and globally.

Specialties: Utilising public policy issues to help drive corporate communications. This includes:

- Managing global research projects,

- Undertaking major corporate thought leadership projects, 

- providing technical assistance on lobbying campaigns,

- media campaigning.

A strong advocate of the need to increase public confidence in retail financial services having campaigned to build awareness of shortfalls in protection insurance and long-term savings.

EXPERIENCE


Executive Director
Cicero Consulting
January 2011 – Present (2 years 1 month)London, United Kingdom
As Executive Director, I am responsible for the company's growing research and thought leadership client base. Major projects over recent years have included the HSBC Future of Retirement programme conducted in 17 countries (www.hsbc.com/1/2/retirement/future-of-retirement); the Scottish Widows annual pensions report and women and pensions report (www.scottishwidows.co.uk/about_us/media.../reports_pensions.html); and AXA's multi-country survey on SMEs. Other recent client mandates have involved working with Alvarez & Marsal, Berwin Leighton Paisner and Standard Chartered. 

In addition, I remain active in public affairs working as a Director on client accounts including Barclays Capital, GE, the Swiss Bankers Association, as well as working as an advisor to the International Financial Centres Forum (IFC Forum).

I currently sit on the American Chamber of Commerce EU committee on financial services and company law and the EU Tax Taskforce.

Director
Cicero Consulting
March 2003 – January 2011 (7 years 11 months)London, United Kingdom
Responsible for servicing a range of clients in the financial services sector on diverse client mandates covering financial services regulation, public policy, corporate thought leadership and marketing. 

In addition to working with a number of blue chip corporate clients, such as GE, Scottish Widows, Invesco Perpetual and Barclays Capital, I also advised HM Treasury's Financial Services Global Competitiveness Review, co-chaired by Sir Win Bischoff and Alistair Darling.

contact-comment:
Comments: Started in banking and consulting for 3 years. Then moved to work for Accenture in London and Italy. Then moved to PR for 2 years at Barabino in Italy. Then moved to Telecom Italia (IH) - he wanted a more int’l approach. He enjoyed it a lot. Managed all the financial and corporate media relations in Italy and worldwide. Led the PR activities during special deals: M&A in Perù, Cile, Turkey, Greece, France, Brazil. Bond issues, PTOs and restructuring deal of the shareholder’ structure. In charge of corp and FPR for 3 years. 25 M&A transactions during his time there. He left as shareholders changed, he was still in contact with Mr Barabino and he asked him to open the London office (2007)

Then he went back to Barabino & Partners as Director - to start up of London operation. Working on IPOs for Italian clients (10 in Italian market in 2006/7). First Italian PR agency that moved to London. Just before crisis and so had a good time to establish. 

• Finalised B&P UK business plan
• Led recruitment of new staff to expand presence in UK
• Managed legal and financial aspects of B&P UK
• Developed and implemented marketing strategies
• Created relationships with main media desks
• Positioned the new Company with main European and UK Public Institutions

Started to work with Citigate as Partners. Completely overtook Citigate. Works specifically on Italian clients from the London market - 70% (€1m turnover of London office) Italian clients, 30% are UK companies (looking at Italian market).

Sector experience: real estate, asset management, banking (a lot - main Italian banks), industrials, o&g, fashion/luxury (on the corporate side). 80% of the portfolio he has brought on himself. 

Been in London 7 years. Wants to broaden out to global markets and not just Italian market. Wants a broader comms role.

CC/FPR split - depends on the year - 2013 was defs on the corporate side, the years before were definitely on the FPR side  
Salary: £150K. Bonus: 10%. Mainly dividends. Would like an uplift - open to opps
New business: LOADS

Next steps - large American company IH. OR a UK agency: open to large agency who wants to develop business outside his home country. His focus hasn’t been in the UK as such.

he said Mr Barabino may sell off his shares to WPP in the next few years so he's keen to be kept in the know

I chatted to him re Finsbury - he knows them from Telecom Italia days. Knows the people - met Rupert 2 yrs ago to chat re his idea to expand to Brazil. Happy for me to chat to them about him

contact-comment:
Comments: Après plusieurs années passées en agences de communication, j’ai acquis une expérience globale tant au niveau des achats (négociations, recherche de prestataires…) qu’au niveau de la vente (gestion de clientèle, développement…)
Mes dernières expériences m’ont notamment permis de parfaire ma connaissance dans des domaines tels que le marketing direct, le marketing relationnel, l’organisation de nombreux évènements et la réalisation d’outils promotionnels de force de vente. 
J’ai été en charge de la prospection, j’ai développé la notoriété d’agences auprès de sociétés de toutes tailles, en proposant et en réalisant avec une équipe, de nombreuses opérations de marketing direct, élaboré les axes de communication et assuré leurs mises en place. 
Mon rôle se situait à plusieurs niveaux : participation aux réflexions stratégiques, propositions d’actions, mise en œuvre et suivi, reporting budgétaire, gestion de l’enveloppe budgétaire, relation clients et également avec les prestataires….
Entre autres expériences pouvant valoriser ma candidature auprès de votre Société, je mettrai plus particulièrement en avant les points :

• Goût pour le développement • Expérience en agence marketing • Sens relationnel •
• Capacité d’écoute • Envie de challenge• Disponibilité et autonomie • Rigueur  • 
• Sens de l’organisation •

Je sais m’adapter à de nouveaux secteurs, et mettre à profit mon expérience et mes connaissances.
