contact-comment:
Comments: Met 8/1/14 
LK 

Excellent candi. Really presentable and personable. 
has been virtually jointly running Riva PR with Founder 
Prior to that 8 years at consumer dynamics - FTI - runnig the consumer arm 

sheis very aware that if she makes a move she needs to make a move now. 
Is leaning toward in-hosue of a larger global agency - would love to retain an element of travel. 
food, drink and lifestyle is of interest 
Wants an agency with structure and like-minded peers, career progression. 
Loves team management and agency operational responsibilities 
excels in client relationship 
startegic brand pertnerships 

LA Tourism - really successful new biz win and her baby. 
They haev done sem great work with BA

Blue Rubicon is of interest 
as is Fleishman, Fishburn and Ketchum 

Somebody has already spoken to her about good relations 

Laura is an accomplished director who counts new business, generating client partnerships and leading client relationships amongst her strengths. Currently working at a specialist boutique agency Laura is now very keen to return to a bigger agency with a wide-ranging client portfolio. Prior to Riva Laura worked across a range of high profile retail, lifestyle and personal finance clients and feels that returning to an agency environment that offers her this diversity, combined with working again in a larger team environment with peers that will challenge and an agency with an ambitious development  strategy is what she is looking for. 

Laura Leggetter 
·	Laura is an Associate Director at specialist travel, lifestyle and property agency Riva PR 
·	As the second most senior team member (behind the founder) one of Laura’s responsibilities is leading the LA Tourism account and the multiple partner relationships with Virgin Atlantic, Universal Studios and British Airways 
·	Previously worked at FD (now FTI) for 8 years and was a founding partner of their consumer offering - Consumer Dynamics 
·	Accounts included Curry’s, Sainsbury’s, EasyJet, Cape Verde Development, Fitness First, RBS and Alliance & Leicester to name a few
·	Passionate new business generator and client relationship lead 
·	Current Salary £72,000 + bonus, 1 months notice

·	Previously ran Portcullis Public Affairs with a combined turnover of £1.6m in 2009 and 13 employees.
·	Clients: Care Quality Commissions, The British Library, GlaxoSmithKline, Bristol- Myers Squibb, Merck Sharpe and Dohme, Proteus, Reckitt Benckiser Pharmaceuticals, Shire Pharmaceuticals etc.
I met with Berkeley last week; he is an experienced Director having set up Decideum in 2009, moving away from its sister company, Portcullis. Decideum currently specialises in providing issues management and public affairs support for a range of healthcare clients across the UK, European Union and US.  Berkeley started his career in politics as an aviation, rail and food policy specialist before establishing Decidum.

contact-comment:
Comments: Need people from different levels
Industry partnerships- helping them with their business model Government of regulatory affairs angles Strategic comms for the new market place

Don't handle day to day PR issues at all Clients stay for 2-4 years Dealing with their start up issues

Clients are in the pre IPO bracket
Top 12 most valued companies 8/9 are their clients
Uber-  Brazil, China,
Snap chat- working on partnerships 

Strategic comms side, maximum exposure in the business space

Economic forum, organise dinners, coming up with the type of deal they should be doing

Industry partnership, country heads handles it Regulatory affairs, strong team, lawyer who has been since the beginning, connected with Downing Street Country heads have political contacts Team that handles the meetings and who they invite, Davos, client entertainment Hosting a dinner

Production of big events and conference, All clients are technology clients

Strategic comms are short staffed
Press work, editorials; FT, big launch, make use they get attention, the economis, Wall Street journal, more about the people Handle that process, brief them, 

24 people in the office, small office in Hong Kong had a New York office for a while If you have your own initiative you thrive Ambitious, self starters likes people who have initiatives 

Build a lot on conference side, co hosting, raising sponsorship Might bring in a partner, moving offices next year, between soho and Hyde park

Younger people work better, clients can identify better with younger people Someone in 30s for senior roles Tech and media experience Digital and media strategy Media background- ex journalist Worked for an internet company Great strategic comms would look at over Conferences a lot, everyone has networks, knows the market and what they are doing Wiired, Wall Street journal, vanity fair, 

Lacard- mobile security app, looking to launch as a corporate security devise Introduce them to companies, 

account director level
Brunswick, finsbury,
Won't look at education

Publishing houses
Would look in-house
Facebook/instagram

Confident person, lots of different nationalities, sociable group, budget for staff entertaining, Hosting a dinner at the next Conservative party conference, go to all of the party conference, hosting
Bonus- 10-30% of base salaries! can buy into shares 70% discount pension, bupa Food and drink in the kitchen
AM- depends on the person/background budget up to 60 Senior. Budget up to 120.00 Working with companies that are shaping future Spottily, übermensch drop box, Sean Parker, media companies, global radio, ari gold

Interview process
Pia first interview
2nd Ian
3rd meet the team

Been looking for a little while, talking to some people Taking to two agencies 

Strategic comms team-
One person left, Pia is managing the team at the moment 

Going away tomorrow

contact-comment:
Comments: Nick Barron - KS met 14.3.16
Enjoying life and well paid he said. But he'd be a fool to not look.
Creative industries, media, crisis, employee engagement. 
Dep MD, 11 Dirs, Snr Dirs, head of specialisms, 
Joined 11 years ago. From footy assoc, wanted out of sport, met Edelman, joined as AD, 15 of them on CC team then. Microsoft and UPS. International work. Global influencers work. More working to CEOs. Clients: Gatwick Airport. Tangible business outcome work. Multi-market 

550 in London. 75 in Corp team. 

Took on a crowd practice role before Jamie Lundie left. Loads of new biz - got sick of the role and leadership. Took a role at Blue Rub but stayed at offer of MD of Corp when Jamie left. 3 years ago as he was bore and wanted a new challenge. 

Stayed for so long as it's been fun and lots of change. Likes organisations that are on the up. Doesn't want to do a turn around. 

Changed the set up of team, numbers clarity. £11m target, £500k left until June 2016. No quarterly targets - only annual as they are independent. Hands on with senior team - 50% mgt of team, 

Lots of change in his first 6 months as md. finding good ppl. Enjoys it and best now Jamie has gone. Can make significant change.

Wants agency - likes being a fee earner. He's done IH. Likes the commercial focus and being held accountable. 

Wants CE role. 
£187k base. Shareholder in Edelman - plus 20% bonus. 
NP - not sure 3-6 months
Brunswick, FTI, FINSBURY - not for him
BR, Portland - likes these 
Doesn't want to move on from a role of this sort after a year. 6 months time.

Size of agency not important - interesting briefs and clients. Not middle of range agencies, not big enough to compete - not to C&W or FHF 

BOUTIQUE - interesting. 

Successor
Rachel isn't MD
Potentially int'd in another Dep MD. he can't move on. 
The Foundary convys. 
Waiting for role sign off 
Seasoned agency person - not pure Corp but probably 
Management experience. Similar role at good agency 
£150-180k
FY17 - starts in July. Brief to come neck month from Nick

contact-comment: Comments: After qualifying as a solicitor, David began his career at Linklaters & Paines in 1982 before joining the corporate finance department of Robert Fleming, the merchant bank, in 1984. He worked at Flemings for 11 years concentrating on M&A, capital raising and business development activities with a focus on a number of sectors, including healthcare and chemicals. He was made a director of Flemings in 1990 with responsibility for developing Flemings’ business in Europe. After four years as a director of Gavin Anderson & Co, working in financial public relations, he joined FD in March 1999 to set up our coverage of the life sciences sector.

contact-comment:
Comments: Christian Cowley
Mid Cap - FTSE 250
Mid & small Cap Markets - IR
Also completed a 4 month stint IH for Royal Mail with Brunswick partner with Tulchan.

RM : Comms & strategy team - really insightful & interesting exposure Strategy Pub Affairs industrial relations Gov side
TULCHAN
50 heads
15 Seniors in London
60/ 65 clients

Fin Comms - 360.
NEW Public Affairs offering.

13 FTSE clients
Lots of FTSE 250 clients
Also looking to main market 100m - 600m
Some around 1m

Tulchan offices: across London, Singapore and in Partners in US & Australia

Enjoys:
M&A, IPO (rights issues), crisis (Homeserve) special situations.
Not had a huge INT exposure with clients Variety of clients - spread across 10 but leading on 6. Hard work. Busy pace.

Challenge:
Can get spread very thinly - frustrating. Key is about servicing the clients.
Quality service, select service, hard work, high level/ quality consultation with clients...as a result they have higher fees.

Andrew Grant - likes to hire from Cap Markets b/g

Key Strengths:
Really understanding business - way it works (from FS) background Some PR people could be one size fits all Can understand the big picture and the finite details - specific.
Listening & understanding the clients need and delivering for them.
Big picture thinking coupled with advice and clear strategy around the detail.
Give clients a first class service from start to finish At Tulchan - knowing Banking contacts and brooked contacts - Jefferies In House senior contact network.

IH opps:
Head of Comms - FS/ PS/ ind
Not right for consumer side (probably suit an ex journists) where Media leads the debate.
Better B2B - industrial....step ahead of the media.
Likes Comms
Suit smaller IH firm - IR & Comms
Not suit about a pure IR role
Happy to go in as a no.2/ 3 for a few years (large) or no.1 Head of Comms or no.2 Make an impact - with FDs and CEOs.

Sal: £120k & 10% pension & bonus (last year £50k)
LF: similar base (look at a wider 'flexible' package - appreciate
NP: tbc 3-6 months
Watch out for non-compete clause - 6 months tbc.

Personal:
Wife
2 kids (6&4)
Lives in Herne Hill

Knows few HH within Comms/ IR - no close relationship

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02 Sep 2014 11:07 JB:
Spoke to Christian Cowley:
12 years as an Analyst/ Director at ABN AMRO
Joined Tulchan just over 4 yrs ago - Analyst Director in FS turned PR man. At Tulchan done a range of things 'admits more of a generalist' with b/g in Transport. 
Small to mid cap size clients - dealing at FD/ CEO/ Head of IR or Head of Comms/ General Secretary level.
Had an In-House tint with Royal Mail in-house for 4 months last year - helping to get their 'ducks in a row'. 
Now sees himself as more of fully fledged "Comms Advisor".

Enjoys:
- Company side - being a trusted advisor/ engagement with clients/ building relationships at senior level (above).
- Consultant at Tulchan is the more senior level - enjoy the client work. Principle-to-principle space. 
- Mid sized companies - not so many blocks with direct access to seniority. With this comes heavy expectations on results and deadlines.
- Some Calendar work but mainly Transactional focus (Fin Analysis, M&A, IPO) and IR/ broader Comms work.

Next steps:
In-house -> 'Head of IR' (pure might be more too narrow a focus) or 'Head or IR and Comms'.
At Tulchan -
NotesId: 372114-6090-14317


Note:  right firm with influence and make a difference - likes variety!

Dislikes/ frustrations:
- None really - but could be intrigued by a new challenge.
- Happy at Tulchan - but nowhere really to go (upwards).
- New ops - in house focusing on just one client and really get your teeth into something and drive improvements.

Clients:
- Mainly FTSE 250: mid cap
- Tech/ Industrial/ Manufacturing/ Consumer.

Fin PR/ IR is a small 'niche' market.
Other:
International has always been an interesting.
Young family - 2 kids (6 4) so some flexibility before they start prep school.

On £120k £50k Bonus Bens - would look from £110/120k base.

Personal email address: christian_cowley@yahoo.co.uk - emailing to tie up a date time to meet for coffee.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Vigo is a strategic communications consultancy with a strong combination of both advisory and corporate experience.

Our senior consultants have advised companies across a range of sectors including oil and gas, commodities trading, mining, renewable energy, TMT, transportation, healthcare and support services.

We have significant transaction experience having led communications on numerous IPOs and both corporate and asset-focused transactions, worth more than $20 billion, over the last twenty years.

We deliver high quality, experience-based counsel coupled with first class execution that address the challenges for companies in today's highly competitive environment.

Comments: 08 Dec 2014 11:43 JB:
Client Meeting Notes - meeting with Simon Brocklebank-Fowler.

Award winning, slick, high quality, top tier Corp Comms consultancy - run by SBF.
Only hire the very best in the market - polished, academic ‘top tier’ professionals. 
Growing business - currently 8 staff - looking to grow to 13/14 over the next 12 months. Great time to join.

Billing £1.5m per year, looking to increase billing to £2-2.5m
This year was the best financial year they’ve ever had in their history - margins up 40%

Pay well and offer unique exposure. Expect a lot in return. Lots of exposure in the company. People need to pull their weight in the company. No hiding place here!

Based in Somerset House but moving to Pall Mall next year.
Discreet - Reputation, integrity & delivery - the punch well above their weight.
Impressive list of clients with long-standing, trusted client relationship at Chief Exec/ CEO/ Secretary of State/ MD levels (many +20 years).
Deliver bespoke, tailor-made campaigns. Liken themselves to a McKinsey in terms of quality & reputation.

Is currently looking for 2 roles: 

Only want Russell Group/ 1st or 2.1 above grades. Must be polished, smart and articulate.

Director: £75,000 to £80,000 - Top Tier Director, ex journo (28-30 yo high flyer)
Consultant : £35,000 to £40,000 - First Class Grad (23-24 yo grad)

Energy & Minerals 
Telecoms, Media & Technology 
Consumer & Leisure

Corp Counsel - senior level
Media Relations
Sell-side and retail Investor Relations
Crisis and litigation comms / planning and management

contact-comment:
Comments: Morning Sarah,

Thanks for the note on LI over the weekend, please find enclosed the JD for the role I was referring to.  In a nutshell we are looking for a either an SAE/AM with strong B2B experience to work on 1 big retained client and a mixture of other clients - will confirm this ASAP.

The main client it will be working on is Honeywell Aerospace - heavy B2B and corporate comms.  I think if someone is technical minded and enjoys working on a big global client then this is very much for them.  It’s most definitely a Tier 1 piece of business for us - current retainer is $24,000 which is about £15/16k per month, so a very important piece of business for us.

We require someone who understands EMEA coordination, working across multiple time-zones and can build relationships with our teams in North America and APAC.  

In terms of the client, as much as it’s corporate comms, they are very fun - we have a super-solid relationship with them.  They do at all times require “gold standard work”, so attention-to-detail is vitally important.

Rebecca Surtrees is the AD who works on this account, she’s super-personable and is currently at the Paris Air Show - so there is the chance to travel and go to the sexy events that work well for this client.  Interest Bex had never worked on Aerospace before this account, but she had a good solid B2B background - so we are very open.  My thoughts were that if someone had maybe worked in Aviation, Aerospace, Oil & Gas, Security, Cloud Computing, Networking or Semiconductor that might work well - again very open though if they are interested and understand the B2B space.

Hope this gives you a bit more context around the role, more than happy to chat through when you are free.

Cheers
Will

60 In London
1/3 tech
Moving towards tech
Pan Asian body shop
Jeep
Microsoft devising
Heritage- America
Microsoft- 20% in uk

Honeywell aerospace- largest account for the tech team Hub coordination EMEA and global coordination Rebecca sutrees- send people to a lot of the gadget shows Doesn't have to have aerospace/aviation

Oil and gas, cloud security networking
Really likes people coming out of Edelman red, Lewis, porter novelli
XTE- Asian telco business
Pan Asia basis
Online video platform- similar skype more geared towards b2b 

Solid benefits
Competitive salary 

Work hard, play hard mentality
24/25 average age

Not a micro managing business, expect people to deliver Global exchange after 12 months 100% independently owned

Trying to explore new markets, want to emerge markets Internal, digital and social studio South Africa is taking off 

20 South Africa 

Looking at some acquisitions at the moment 

Media relations-
Hem Raheja-
Junior account manager
13% bonus 

Average across the agency is 10/11%
Bracket mid 30s + 13% bonus
25 days holiday
Contributed pension
Private medical and dental
Global exchange
70 or quater as a lifestyle benefit
Wee connect £16 per month 

No late culture 9-6pm

Challenges- 

1 Rebecca
2 presentation 

Recruitment- 

Talent
Ecom

Candidates- fully signed off







Sent from my iPad

Comments: Stephanie joined FD in December 2000 as a partner within the Consumer team to run FD's property offer. She has been working in PR and IR for over 13 years, a career she began after studying History at Cambridge University. As well as working in consultancy, Stephanie spent time as an assistant manager of SBC Warburg's Institutional Investor Relations department. She joined FD from GCI Financial where she was a director primarily responsible for formulating strategy and implementing communication programmes for listed companies. 

She currently advises Land Securities, GE Commercial Finance Real Estate, Rockspring, CBRE Investors, Schroder Property Managers (Jersey), Castlemore, Delancey, Lend Lease, Helical Bar, DTZ, Rugby Estates and Quintain. Past clients include The Association of Property Unit Trusts, PRICOA Property PLC, Milner Estates, Fletcher King, Hercules Property Services, Safestore and Schroders plc.

contact-comment:
Comments: Hola,
Me gustaría hablar con Lourdes

Hi Lourdes,

Further to my voicemail I was keen to get in touch and make you aware of an Account Director I am representing in who is looking to relocate to Madrid. 

My candidate has both Spanish and UK experience and is looking to move to Madrid by the end of the year. 

Overview: 
·         14 years experience in marketing and communication agencies, both advertising and healthcare advertising / ATL and BTL, transitioning in the last years from paper to digital
·         Has experience developing, implementing and coordinating European and Global projects. Work experience in Barcelona and London 
·         Currently Senior Account Director/Planner at H4B London leading on accounts like Janssen, Merck Serono, Bayer (ophthalmology), Activis and recently won Teva Europe - previously at CDM London 
·         Passionate about building brands through providing strategic value and ensuring flawless execution 
·         Good team player, managerial experience, and consistently performs to a high level 
·         Notice period three months

If you are hiring at this level and open to learning more about this candidate please let me know the best time to give you a call. 

Thank you very much, 

Best wishes,
Marie

contact-comment:
Comments: MET with 26/01/16 JS and KS

CNC 26.1.2016 with Kinvarra Delmont
Same company 

CNC started in 2001 - same time as Cap MSL. CNC strong presence in Germany and globally. Start of 2015 - successful merge as complement each other lots. Only office that came together in London. 

Reports into both MSLGroup and CNC Group. Reporting into EMEA. CNC doesn't report into MSL in London - both report into EMEA Group. 

Next week will know promotions after management meeting. Couple of weeks will know more re recruitment. Mid-level (AD - 'Consultant') - she has problems hiring at that level. 

Established AD ideally. The current guy is leaving after 10 years at end of February. 

41 in London. Globally - 110 ppl. 
*Intern - £15k per year. 
*Associate - entry level. Internally have junior associate (intern done good level), associate (may have 12-18 months exp). Junior associate - £23/24k. Associate (£27-30k). 
*Senior associate - 18-24 months+ - up to early £40k. 3yrs at that level 
Consultant - up to £60k 
*Senior Consultant - £60-90k. Maturing, running account, go-to person, key role allowing senior ppl to go win new business. New biz targets  (20% target) - actively pursuing/networking. 
*Director - part of Management team, decision making, only level that line manage. Just salaried. 
*MDs - 2 in London. Much heavier on something. Ollie - Ops, HR AND integration, less billable hours. Other is Ben Curson - focused on branding and messaging and overall growth. MDs in Tokyo and Dubai. 
*Partners - Nick Bastin, Claire Money, Kevin Sobey 
Partnership team globally called Exec Committee Board (all got responsibilities) - big picture of running agency globally 
*Managing Partners - Richard Campbell and Roland
*CEO in Munich - Bernard 

8x ppl started as interns and are now high up in agency. Tenure is 5 years plus. Recognition and reward is key. Flexible working environment. 

Searching for a year for consultant. SC, Dir, C levels all needed. 

Two offers fell through last year. Henry Waller (gone to Finsbury last year). FPR & CC mix (FS). 

Need to be exceptional. Won't settle. PREPARED, researched, attitude, speaks German. 

Richard Rigby starting at CNC. Loved his attitude - more CC. He was prepped and researched. 

Tom Buchanan from Maitland joining. Managing Partner

Olivia Griffiths (Dir) leaving CNC to go IH. 

Check on Tom Climie. Kinvarra Delmont. 

Clients: Mars, BP 
FS clients: 

Kinvarra hates schmoozy recruitment chat, salesy approach, hates when recruiters go over her head, disliked James Baybutt and his approach. 

James: send salary survey.

Happy to retain. Conscious of costs. Will chat to us in future. Has to manage with the Group. Will know in February 16. 

Constant searching their side. Not a timeframe with recruiters. Always open and honest about who they are seeing. 






08 Apr 2015 17:44 JB:
Spoke to Kinvarra - Capital MSL/ CNC - new AM role
Somebody leaving - Tuuliske Tuulas (Estonia - joined as an intern). Absolute rock in the team. Tried to counter her but really wants in-house.
Her end date is 15th May - May is a very busy time on. Going to AXA Investments

This role involves working with James Madsen
Got a list of clients: SSGA (State Street), Priciple Global Investment, World Plentum Investment (NEW), BNP Pariba, CapGemini
Media Relations - FS
Media Knowledge
Ambitious type
Interview ASAP - 2 stages process and test (get given the FT and assess key points & analysis) and page on Powerpoint doc with typos etc (attention) t
NotesId: 768217-7775-1626


Note: o test.
Clare Maloney - due to going on mat leave in the next few months. 

Merger with CNC - going really well. Exciting times - best 1st Q ever.
Had quite a few leavers. Down to skin and bones - quiet a few leavers. Brought in quite a few interns.
Really promoting mobility - travel to German offices. 
Doing really well with training and develop
 Office move - from Whitfield Street to Chancery Lane.
Keen to start interviewing now - CV ASAP
Bens include:
25 days!
Season ticket loan
Business finders fee! (you get 5% of revenue)

contact-comment:
Comments: 07 Sep 2015 10:05 JB:
Simon McGough
KPMG - 5 yrs (2 years after audit)
Vodafone - 4 years 

Did economics and politics at uni
Audit at KPMG
IR - commercial

Enjoys IR and numbers mixed with writing and presenting. Showed loyalty.

Vodafone - FTSE 6
Career progression limited (banding level)

26 Operations - gets regular investor queries covering: Finance, Operations & Technology
Talk to analysts & investors

To move externally Finance or IR,,,

IR roles wants:
Step up in career - Director or Head of....
OR
FTSE 250 doing IR plus Treasury, Communications or MA OR FTSE 250 or AIM with a view to getting back in broader Finance

Open on sector: tech / media sectors. No to banking/ FS.
Intertec - main KPMG clients

IR duties:
Results: quarterly results and prepping packs - press releases Year End : annual report Learnt so much at VF over the last 4 years - now doesn't want to plateau....

Typical week:
Consensus - 23 investor models - talking to sell side analysts, numbers and modelling Email to company twice a day Dealing with M&A and strategy teams at Vodafone (e.g. VF bought Onno last year) Roadshows, conferences and investor meetings (2 p/w) Research on markets and planning and prep of annual budgets (2 catch up budgets) Direct contacts to CFO and CEO at Group level (doing there presentation) Does both management roadshows & IR exclusive Investor roadshows - a few times a year Simon & a colleague wrote most of the most annual report - final draft Deals with country markets - FD of Holland releasing Broadband last year Team of 6 having different.Deals with Germany - deals with German Finance team - results and a analysts
Now: conference season
Has a good overview of the entire company Dealing with Investor specific issues (crisis management e.g. if their was leaked documents or info) The skills of being a Head of IR - to keep Investor happy

Was in Asia in Feb - IR - Simon & his boss went together
Travel - in total 6 weeks pw - in Nov 2 weeks

Sal: On £80k base (LA and car) & bonus & pension
NP: 3 weeks. Not going away any time soon.
------------------------------------------------------------------
27 Aug 2015 17:02 JB: 
Tele call.... ok to email him at work - updated CV en route.
SUMMARY: Simon McGough
Been at Vodafone for 4 years and enjoyed life there.
Looking at internal options at Vodafone (FTSE listed). Works in a busy team of 6.
Managing relationships and communicating with internal & external stakeholders
Simon’s background in Audit, KPMG - wanted to 
Heard about an IR opportunity whilst auditing at Intertec
B/g in IR and Finance/ CFO options
Is on the Vodafone Finance excellence programme - able to link business needs with FP&A or Commercial Finance teams e.g. Business Partnering, Business Intelligence team (data, dashboards and KPI and working with the commercial and strategy sides)
Not actively looking, but exploring internal options so open to exploring external roles also
Unlikely to take the CFO route at Vodafone - still 10 years off - and would need to work for VF abroad. Not keen. Recently bought a house and girlfriend just started her own business.
Works for Vodafone Group (HO) based in Paddington. 
Salary: £80k (plus London allowance and car allowance) plus 20% bonus (individual & company performance), 10% pension & £20k shares.
NP: 3 months
Works in Telco (VF likes ppl from Technology, Market Insights, FS background to get a mix of skills)
Sectors: NO NO to Banking/ FS
simon.mcgough@vodafone.com

contact-comment:
Comments: Meeting JS and KS - 2/2/16

Tulchan
Lydia Davies: HR, mainly ops and she enjoys this most. Manages central team.
Michelle - consultant, director level. Helping Lydia. 3 days a week until June 2016. 

69 in London, 10 in Singapore, 1 in NYC. 24/7 coverage. Plans to move more into nyc. 
FPR and capital markets-heavy. Everyone mucks in. All like each other. 
PA added first based on client need. Don't do corporate and never will actively. IR - want to do more of. Don't want to be massive. 
70 clients - FTSE100 x13. 
Brunswick, Finsbury, Maitland, Greenbrook, Bell Pott

Transparent about salaries now. High retention. Ppl only leave for IH. Advisory key. 

Lydia doesn't have a hands-on approach. Doesn't like being pushed when haven't had sign off on role. Strict on salary bands. Lots of contact required. No specs. Out of blue competitors. 

£80k+ large searches. Michelle search. Retainer feedback. 

Mixed bag - no pharma at moment. Mid-cap team. Quite a lot of tech. Crisis creds - looked after Co-op and Merlin Alton Towers, Royal Mail IPO. 
Filming suite and editing suite 

No divisions, like to mix it up. 

Advisory set up: 
*CEO - Andrew Grant (nbd). On Lloyd's account. Some financial clients. Entrepreneurial - he devised the app. 
*Managing Partner - David Schriver (Carrefour and investment banking background) 
*Partners - nbd, involvement in running of business, working on big accs. Equity shareholders. £150k+
*Directors - no equity, no new biz involvement, £80-150k+, running accs 
*Associates  - £40-80k. Running small accs. Not first jobbers. Running small clients, media handling. 
*Analysts - Training role, sitting in on meetings 

Now a separate offering: Tulchan Analytics - media monitoring, got an app, mainly for board/c suite clients, human. Often grads, £25k. Interested in media and cap markets. Can step up to advisory role. 

Central team: account administrators - support to clients

Tom Cahn: just two Partners. Not susannah or Steven 
Peter Hewer: knowledge of cap mkts qs
David Allchurch: ex invest banker, not a pussy cat, lovely 

New analyst role reqs: Starting £30k, ideally competitor, hit ground running, analyst somewhere else. Lives and breathes the papers. 





Lydia Davis - HR & Operations Manager
ldavis@tulchangroup.com
+44 (0) 20 7353 4200

I work very closely with the Managing Partner to ensure that the office runs smoothly behind the scenes. My main role is Human Resources which involves handling all the non-Consultant recruitment, resourcing and performance management as well as making sure that everyone has the relevant training in order to develop and work to the best of their abilities.

I am the ‘go to’ person for most of the staff here which means that I am able to keep everyone informed on what is happening within Tulchan and also sort out any problems people may have. In addition to this I am a part of the Management Team sharing ideas regarding operations, infrastructure and strategy. I also carry out a lot of Company Secretary work including looking after the Board.

contact-comment:
Comments: Lovely guy. very open and chatty 

The MDs head up a team of ppl doing a client assignment. Mark has 45 ppl to look after. Financial team is 65 strong (H&P of MHP were FPR agencies). Brand practice is the smallest practice. PA practice. 

Mark's remit is 80% bus devt - by his design - he likes it. He's been focused on for past 2.5 years - expanding their int'l profile (very few intl clients or any profile when he joined MHP). 

Corp team: just shy of £4m revenue - 65% of it is int'l - mainly Middle East and Asia. Just acquired a business in HK. Mark is threading clients together in London, ME and Asia. They have the autonomy to grow the business/sectors/left alone to do what they want as long as they bring in the £££.

MHP is the biggest piece of the Engine pie - of all the 13 agencies within it. 70 Engine Partners. No real benefit of being an Engine partner - no real monetary incentive as there are so many ptrs. He's part of SMT at MHP - 6 of them - they steer the direction of the agency, they all have client responsibiity (by design - even the CEO has clients), they balance operational resps with new biz and client work. Likes havign fingers in the pie. Had pure operational role when he ran the NYC office of C&W and he left that cos he wanted client resps and NBD.

LOVES: people devt, new biz, client service 

How's Engine relationship: as Engine grows it becomes more distant from its original mission, it's quite distracted as it tries tio find more funding - equals more pressure on the diff agencies to bring in more revenue.Lkg to attract investors.and its tough on them.

He creates an environment that suits him and his personality ad the way he likes to work. Has a lot of autonomy to change his world.

Eco-system around his world - taking the Engine out of his world, he would like it better and he's move for that. Different environment. More entreprenaurial/smaller environment/likes inde offering/autonomy and resp/less red tape.

Salary: Engine Partner so that gets him on the long-term incentives plan (The L-Tip - ill-defined - never a guaranteed anything). Often additonal bens for the good of the team. He gave up his bonuses to make sure that's happened in the past. Not a guaranteed anything. Salary: £240K - nothing outside of that. 

His team grew by 205, his revenue grew by 20% - but no guarantee he will get anything for that. 

Re Lansons: nice size, good number of people. He feels it's quite tribal when it gets to 200 ppl/spread out physically. Lansons brand is well regarded and he knows them.

Comments: Dear Peter,

It was great speaking to you and thank you for your time. Please see below a link to the portfolio of the Designer I met this morning and who is currently on the market. <http://www.coroflot.com/ricardofortepace> . 

Snapshot:
·	Over 5+ years experience in experiential and product design
·	Clients portfolio includes Procter & Gamble, Nextel, Coca-Cola
·	Rose from junior designer to senior level leading a team within just over 3 years
·	Highly engaging, very interested in Minale Tattersfield

As we are head-hunters specialising in the branding and design space and the portfolio is of interest, why don’t we have a short meeting so I can get to know more about Minale Tattersfield’s culture and business plans for 2015. How would Thursday the 26th suit?
I am looking forward to hearing your thoughts.

Kind regards,
Annette

contact-comment:
Comments: CNC - Communications & Network Consulting (key word here is “network”). CNC have never marketing themselves to date. Business has been built up through Richard & Christopher’s networks. Admits CNC brand ‘unknown’ in this country

Fourth largest leading strategic and financial comms consultancy - 150 ppl globally (50 in Munich; 50 in London)

CNC (German Fin Comms consultancy) Senior, board level clients. Strategic. Expensive but high quality, high value. Less listed work more big M&A deals. A market leader in Germany. Seen as similar to a Brunswick!

Original founders: Roland Klein (former Head of Comms/ Senior VP at Ericsson) and Christoph Walther (former Head of Comms/ Senior VP at DaimlerChrysler). Now works p/t.

Team: Senior Exec team made up of Roland, Christopher, Richard Campbell, Ben C.
CNC - Nick Bastin (Capital Managing Partner) and Oli Mann (MD CNC)
MSL - James Parsons, Claire Maloney (strat) on a mat leave

CNC much more of a high-end consultancy rather than an agency. Don’t do press office work.
Less micro-man more focused on execution and delivery of client work

Both CNC and Capital were bought up by MSL 3 years ago. CNC and Capital merger at the start of 2015 to bring together a combined International, integrated offering.

Group made up of:
CNC - Europe
Capital - London & ME
Kekst & Company - New York
JKL - the leading strategic communications firm in the Nordic Region
Salter Baxter - strategic sustainability & communications (Bayswater)
SAS - digital

MSL now able to bring together a fully integrated mix of Corp and Fin, Consumer, HC, Tech and Digital under one roof (one P&L)

CNC - International consultancy - offices London, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dubai, Tokyo, Deli
In the past 6 months 30% staff have spent b/w 2-4 weeks working in international offices.

Clear strategy to invest heavily in data technology and insights

Ben Curson b/g: Instictif - do listed/ plc IPO work

USPS:
Interesting work - Commercial, strategic client servicing - Integrated International consultancy with unparalleled mobility - Forward thinking - Committed to excellence - Treat staff well - Exciting times - Liberating / flexibility (manage timesheets) - Less focus on money & title - Want to be challenged, stretched - Bonuses linked to contribution - Own clients

All moving into together in paddington 
Good robust intv process 
Ben leads corporate and financial services - there are other MDs in London 
Richard Campbell leads it - Ben reports in 
Low turnover

Comments: Guislain a 42 ans, 20 ans d'expce.
Il commence sa carriere chez BDDP (2ans) en tant que CR, puis DDB en team avec olivier cortemanche (2ans)
puis Widen&kennedy amsterdam pour s'occuper de Nike (ts media, tres 360) pendant 4 ans, participes aux compettitions campagnes internationales sur gros brief.
Monte en 2001 le singe (hotshopcreative)chez betc avec Nike. Gagne sephora, playstation (en marge de ce qu ils faisaint chez TBWA)
en 2003 passe DC adjoint chez BETC, continu a faire de la creation (campagne air france, skyteam, disneyland paris-compet gagnee et va s'occupe a 100% de ce client pdnt 2 ans).
Puis il est contacte par JWT qui a une volonte de depoussierer l'agence; projets de + en + digital, gros client nestle (kitkat, glace extreme) Wilkinson, nokia, Mazda
25 pers a la creation
rolex + gros client (entre paris et NYC)
il est en train de reussir a faire prd le virage du web a l agence
Ce qui le ferait bouger : un projet, une agence

salaire 16 000 fix + voiture de fonction (a verif ???)

contact-comment:
Comments: the interview will take place in our Holborn office with me and a member of the HR department. Documents required for the interview: ID to access the permises, CV and business plan if Victoria has any.
The format of the interview is really straight forward:
- presentation of MAS
- motivation to work in recruitment
- assets of the candidate
- markets (perm and/or contract, countries, contacts) where the candidate can create value and turnover
 
This interview could be followed by a second interview the following day if both parties are interested.
Do not hesitate to come back to me if you require further information.

contact-comment:
Comments: Meeting notes 

Incredibull - privately owned 
Met with Grayling and F1 through a recruiter - liked Grayling a lot - but didnt get it. Thats the right sort of opportunity 

Incredibull - was brought in as a freelancer for Bayer - they win the pitch 
asked her to stay on perm and then promoted to MD 
Since taking control - she has re-written company stratgies, missions, re-positioning 
Feels she has helped take the business in a place they wouldnt have gone on their own. 

Strengths - retaining and growing business 
- writing pitches
profitabilty of running a busienss 
- doesnt want a pure new business role 

Excels is client relationships 

Feels now that there isnt really room for her to progress 
Management have been difficult at times as privately owned. 

40% billable hours 60% running a business 

Next - in-house, global network
Intergrated networks are exciting 
Wants to be part of an exciting team - good ideas and help make is spectacular 
has doen well with big brands 

Surname + Surname could be interesting 
Excele is high-end brand experience 


Current package is £125k, 10% bonus, £10,000 pension

contact-comment:
Comments: Gilles LAMARQUE dispose d’une expérience de 15 ans dans la gestion des affaires publiques à Paris et à Bruxelles. Il compte parmi ses clients de grands groupes français et étrangers et plusieurs associations professionnelles. Il conduit par ailleurs des opérations d'accompagnement en management des affaires publiques. 

Responsable des affaires publiques de Renault à Paris et à Bruxelles pendant 7 ans en charge de la réglementation et des négociations communautaires, il a connu les grandes évolutions du secteur automobile : les restructurations du secteur, la prise en compte des phénomènes environnementaux et la poussée des sensibilités anti-automobiles, la globalisation du secteur, le dialogue avec les associations de consommateurs et d'usagers, l'adaptation aux exigences du développement durable, etc.

Précédemment responsable des affaires européennes chez Publicis, il a participé au positionnement du groupe sur les affaires européennes, à des appels d'offre de la communauté et a conseillé plusieurs entreprises et organisations dans leur réflexion institutionnelle.

Gilles LAMARQUE a débuté sa carrière au MEDEF où il était en charge des relations avec les pouvoirs publics locaux et du suivi de la décentralisation.

contact-comment:
Comments: Guy joined Financial Dynamics in 1997 and set up the agency's consumer finance division, which was rolled into FD Consumer Dynamics on launch in December 2002. As MD, Guy remains active with the division's clients and works with the account teams on strategy, campaign creatives and evaluation.

Guy also drives the division's research and market intelligence services, which comprise monthly reports on evocative news issues, innovative tracking of how consumers digest news and regular focus group work - something key to any consumer practice. A keen strategist, Guy has delivered more than 70 strategy workshops since 1999 and, with more than 200 interviews under his belt, also facilitates FD's message coaching sessions.

Guy has extensive experience working with brand leaders. Clients Guy has worked with include - Alliance & Leicester, various HBOS businesses, easyJet, Morgan Stanley, Goldfish, RAC, Land Securities,  Marks & Spencer, npower, the National Trust and Camelot

Prior to joining FD, Guy spent six years as a PR practitioner with NatWest and worked with a number of local radio stations.

contact-comment:
Comments: I have almost 15 years of experience in corporate positioning, creative campaigns, issue management and communications advisory in the Gulf. 

As the first hire for Brunswick in Dubai, I co-established the firm’s presence across the GCC. I advise the senior management and boards of local government and semi-government entities, and private and public regional and international companies on their communications with multiple stakeholder groups. I advise clients from a diverse set of sectors across the GCC on positioning, reputation management, media relations and employee engagement. 

Specialities: Strategic communications, corporate positioning, communications campaigns, issue management communications, IPO and transactions communications and digital media.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
May 2007 - Present (1 year 1 month) | Hopscotch, Consultant
(Privately Held; 51-200 employees; Public Relations and Communications industry)
Hopscotch is a public relations and information strategies consultancy 
Its mission is to help brands, corporations and institutions, in designing and implementing their PR strategies. 
According to the last Ballester agency survey, Hopscotch is one of the most creative, reactive and strategic PR firms in the French market. 
Hopscotch has grown steadily since its creation in 2000. It quickly reached the French Top 10 of PR agencies. With 60 consultants and revenues of 6 M $ in 2005 (Euro 5 M), Hopscotch is the second largest independent PR consultancy in France. 
Missions: 
- Advise and building of public relations programs 
- Customer relation. 
- Press relations : redaction of press kits, contacts with key journalists, interviews organisation, identification and evaluation of speaking opportunities, networking. 
- Development : member of Hopscotch PR Lab 
- Clients: Danone Eaux France, CEDUS (organization for information and documentation on sugar), Heidrick & Struggles.

May 2005 - April 2007 (2 years) | Opinion Valley, Consultant
(Privately Held; 11-50 employees; Public Relations and Communications industry)
Advise on public relations program, customer relation. 
Press relations : redaction of press kits, contacts with key journalists, interviews organisation, identification and evaluation of speaking opportunities, networking. 
Development : recommendations, quality process (ISO certification). 
Expertise on High Tech and Internet - Accounts : Google, AOL, Lulu.com.

Education
CELSA (School of Higher Studies in the Information and Communication Sciences) 
Master, Information and communication sciences, 2002 - 2006 
2006: Holding a Magistere of Communication from the CELSA - Paris Sorbonne IV 
2006: Dissertation intitled "The French publishing world facing the digitalization" - Google Book Search case study. Very good mention 
2004: Dissertation intitled "The compact disc, a syncretic object". Good mention
Handelshøjskolen i Århus 
master, marketing, 2004 - 2004 
Erasmus semester fosused on consumer behavior studies and management of innovation.
ISEG 
BTS, Marketing, Communication, 2000 - 2002 
Ecole supérieure d'Electronique de l'Ouest-ESEO ANGERS, 1999 - 2000

Comments: 17 Feb 2015 11:03 AF:
Met her with Tazie. 
Working with agencies Purple, Gabriele Skelton, We are together on fee ranges from 18% to 22%

Profiles needed:
- VERY creative (thining process needs to be evident in work profile)
- most candidates come from Bulletproof, JKR, Designbridge

Roles:
Mid-weight Designer NOW
Account manager in June

Environment:
Very social, every Fri evening design sharing round and night out
They like very open people, young talent is fostered and given opportunity to go and run with their ideas
calm , collaborative, fun

Structure:
11 Designers, 9 account handlers, artworkers, freelancers, 1 new biz person. 

Currently working on:
Sedish cereal brand, Heineken, Fosters, fmcg, etc

Future plans
Not expanding ex UK but expanding work portfolio - have hired a new Biz director to take the 50% weighting off their Sainsbury's account..

Interview process: 
first with Celine and Charlotte - intital bonding chat
Second with John and / or Steve

contact-comment:
Comments: 06 Jan 2016 13:31 KS:
MET HIM
keen to go to MSL for their MD of Corp role. Kelly Walsh, Dominic Payling and Blair Metcalfe can all vouch for him. Previously at MSL 2008-2011 - was in charge with the repitch for Philips. Got 'Employee of the Qtr' at MSL in 08. He joined MSL when they were 130 ppl and when he left there were 34

Cross sector expeirence with lots of Hcare as he's works in an integrated way with Ogilvy Healthworld.
He's now head of Corp whilst Adam Powell is off on sabbatical for 3 mths. 
People person - leads and inspires and motivates teams
Was Dir at Fleishman before but was HH'd by Ogilvy - he organically grew the crisis offering and won lots of new biz 
Lots of crisis exp but broader than that

Wants a higher role with respon and autonomy as feels he does the role now but has no ownership. Adam Powell rules in alpha way and that's not David.  He does financials, capacity, team mgt, client mgt, team structure and hiring, targets 

On £85K - NO PAY RISE IN 3 YEARS!!! With a step up such as MSL he wants ideally £120, would think about it on £115, but no less than £110K. Non-negotiable 3 mth notice. Package is £95K with pension, gym, healthcare. Bonus is 5-10% but usually is 5% - due to be paid out in March 2016.

contact-comment:
Comments: Julian is responsible for running the day-to-day operations of the London office, including finance and staffing, as well as managing several international PR accounts including Invesco Continental Europe, InfraHedge, EDHEC-Risk Institute and HC Trading. He manages client relationships and is involved in strategic media relations including devising campaigns and pitching stories to journalists. 

He has worked at CitySavvy for nearly seven years and alongside PR activity has also been involved in strategic content development and digital communications for a global FMCG company, writing and editing for its European employee intranet programme, as well as providing day-to-day project management. 

Julian has experience working for international clients in a variety of industries including FMCG, banking, asset management, private equity, managed accounts platforms, exchange-traded funds, construction, chemical distribution and technology.

Julian is a native Dutch-speaker and has a BA(Hons) degree in English Literature from the University of Leeds.

contact-comment:
Comments: Met with Janie and Sarah 29/05

3 businesses;
1. pr and social - Panasonic, poly com, fico, IBM, Intel - build or campaigns 
2. Customer advocacy and marketing - largely b2b
3. Digital and social media - Merketo

Most people work in one specific area - design people sit separately 

New Deputy MD starting next week - comes from PR background - Jenna keighley

Panasonic - Sind quite traditional pr
They work in a very integrated way 

Have quite a structure; consultant, lead consultant, senior consultant then leadership team (associate directors) 
Don't tend to recruit 

Need to prepare well for an interview 
Interview structure; 1st stage of the interview 
Need to think would clients would hire them - need people that would be able to work there

Consultant - less experienced and more able - would always go for this
Tech is better but would take corporate pr people too 
£26,000-28,000
Big global multi nationals 
Do some psychometric testing 

Not just charming, well presented etc
Got some Oxbridge people, one guy without a degree, now a writer - likes wild cards sometimes 
People who want to develop 
Don't bill by the hour 
Looking to grow their new business 
Pr largely EMEA - want to grow in the US 
Likes people from overseas 

Bad words; want more autonomy or want to be more strategic 

Speculative people

Where do you like people from?

contact-comment:
Comments: 

Michael founded Aura in May 2004, with a range of long-standing former clients, to advise listed and private companies, regulators, governments, shareholders and individuals. The aim was to create a small team to work on interesting assignments for clients who understood and valued the Aura consultancy approach.

Michael previously established Prospero Financial within Bridgepoint Capital’s Hatch-Group, specialising in financial communications and investor relations. Prospero reached the UK M&A top ten league table within 18 months. Following the acquisition of Prospero by Huntsworth PLC, Michael left to establish Aura.

Over many years Michael has advised on transactions for clients including Active Value, Xstrata, BHP Billiton, L’Oréal, New World Resources, Pinault Printemps Redoute, African Minerals, Interbrew, and English China Clays. The total value of these transactions is over $170 billion.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Brett McKibbin
Chief Strategy Officer

Brett heads up Strategy at iProspect, setting out the vision for integrated and performance delivery, and ensuring that technology and data are used in the most effective way to support our clients’ business objectives and leverage their consumers’ digital behaviour. With over 20 year’s industry experience in building and managing integrated direct response campaigns, and with key data planning and strategic skills, Brett has worked across verticals including utilities, finance, FMCG, technology, publishing, travel and automotive. More than ten years at Aegis, he has led iProspect sister company Carat’s Direct team before moving to iProspect in 2011. Originally trained in both forensic chemistry and customer service, this highly unusual combination somewhat explains his relentless drive to unlock value from data – and why he’s a stickler for detail.

contact-comment:
Comments: As the Middle East and North Africa’s premier social media agency, The Online Project is a Jordanian based startup that develops and executes social media strategies for Fortune 500 companies and high profile organizations operating in the region. 

The company is revolutionizing the way businesses in the MENA region talk to their customers. Founded in 2009, The Online Project began by focusing on the telecommunications industry in the region and has since expanded to service the technology, airline, FMCG, and fashion industries. 

The Online Project operates in three countries in the Middle East. With its operational base in Jordan, a business development office in Dubai, and an extension of its business development presence in Saudi Arabia, the company is uniquely positioned to service a truly regional clientele. 

The Online Project currently serves global brands such as UNICEF, Samsung, and Nestle.

contact-comment: Comments: Geoffrey is responsible for City PR, Investor Relations, and M&A. He has an in-depth knowledge of the financial services industry, with over 19 years of experience in investor relations, banking, and fund management. Sector experience includes work for Credit Agricole (merger with Credit Lyonnais), Allied Irish Banks (sale of Allfirst to M&T Bank and communications advice following suspected treasury fraud), Egg (acquisition of Zebank), National Bank of Greece (merger talks with Alpha Bank) and Zurich Financial Services (sale of Scudder to Deutsche Bank and purchase of its Continental European Insurance assets). Prior to joining Financial Dynamics, he was Head of Investor Relations for the NatWest Group, where he played a leading role in the defence against the hostile bids by Bank of Scotland and The Royal Bank of Scotland. An Associate of the Chartered Institute of Bankers, he also held a number of senior lending positions at NatWest, in Corporate and Small Business banking. Before that, he was a fund manager for Leopold Joseph.

contact-comment:
Comments: very good discussion
everybody liked him

questions around his leadership skills - he's experience
not worried about it - coached and supported about that
very flexible about that

it doesn't need to be an indipendent unit
kind of metrix - they can create a unit

they don't have the answer for that - they are not sure, depends on the individual
there is flexibility - it can be both! 

joining on a contract base
will allow them the flexibility
play with budget

informal presentation

Clear ideas - he knows the MD
copuple of 1st with 2 other agencies - not sure how keen is 

Clear - senior management - not on the board - 100K mark
Ipsos
qual role - part ownership of the company small company - start up situation - salary share based remunaration

can't rank them

salary around the 100K - they asked him about it and he said
won't consider less then 90K

the distinction is also FMCG

he knows pharma really well and FMCG has some experience

no reservation - he can see where they all fit in
the person he's looking to work with is Sarah - she's really experienced - she was the one that seems to understand more about the challenge of bulding the qual unit
Gareth is someone he can talk freely - he got a broader view
Michael was very open 
they have a good solid team

he's seriously considering the role

he worked for clear before and coming back can be a bit hard - 

Ipsos is going to be tough - Clear killed him, work load is crazy and tough environment
Ipsos is a more confortable place to work

he would probably cycle to work - takes about 40 Min, more than a 1hour with public transport - do they have a shower????

the option to work from home is good but not a key factor in the decision making process

He lives in Brantwood

he wasn't even looking and all these opportunties came up

what if the offer from Ipsos come before??? he will give an answer within a week

he's meeting clear next Friday - he will get an offer on the table

contact-jobTitle: National Director for Patients and Information

contact-comment:
Comments: Red Health (a division of The Red Consultancy) ranks in the top 10 of the PR Week Healthcare PR Agency league table.  It has a reputation for delivering highly creative, cut-through campaigns for a stellar list of clients and has won multiple industry awards (just last week it won an OTC Marketing Award).  

It has an excellent track record in winning new business (in the last five months alone it has won briefs from MSD; Novo Nordisk and Janssen), is fiscally very healthy and has great potential for further growth, expansion and diversification.
We need a leader for Red Health that will realise that potential and continue the upward trajectory... someone whose wealth of experience and knowledge of the industry combined with clear vision, dynamism and ambition will make Red Health an even bigger/better player than it currently is. 
For the right person it’s an opportunity to take the reins of a great business and make it an outstanding business... to make their mark in the Healthcare PR industry.
The person will be well connected, able to attract great talent, strategic, entrepreneurial and have a passion for the craft.

contact-comment:
Comments: 01 May 2015 14:32 JB/ GS:

Background
Public affairs, CC, property and PS
Worked with clients like Morrisons, St Modwin, Development securities, Hotels, National Grid. (CC, B2B)
Also Lake house who he help work through an IPO.
He is a specialist in CPR and would like to continue this into a next role. He feels like he has gained as much as he can from Camargue 
He has already been for an interview at Portland and liked the international offering.
He has a second a Brunswick next week.
He pretty much ran the pitch for London and Aberdeen group and won that client. (Loves that side of things)
Expressed an interest in working abroad.

Sell in:
Alexander Hall
·	Account Manager at Camargue- Alexander plays a role in managing key client relationships and winning new business for a range of sectors across the corporate and investor community.
·	Clients managed and grown include Morrisons, St Modwin, Development securities, Mini Hotels, National Grid and London and Aberdeen group (he won pitch).
·	Alexander's strengths include managing and maintaining healthy client relationships; the ability to plan and execute strategic campaigns; delivering effective corporate communications programmes and the pitching and winning new business.
·	Alexander has experience working in investor relations, corporate communications and working across property and further professional services.
·	Prior to Camargue, Alexander worked as an Assistant Director for the Oxford Imps.
·	£35,000 p/a base salary, plus benefits; and 3 months notice.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

22/10/13

SAE - 1 month (2 years at company) 
Sectors looking at - Tech, would like to branch out away from property a bit. not 100% sure what direction he is looking for 
doesnt want to work for competitors 
put CV into portland 2 days ago, likes look of college hill, Looking for bigger company 
Wants a step up. 
CC side - step up in terms of blue chip clients
PA side - stepping up lobbying wise, more policy-focused work
Enjoys straddling both but for the right thing he would slant to either side. Absolutely 
Sector: property planning, retail, leisure, hotels, public sector (school), construction. Tried little else, doesn’t dislike the property sector. Would broaden.
At Camargue for 2 years, SAE for a month.
IH or agency. Not desperate to leave Camargue but interested in next step. No direct competitor. Bit of a step change.
Property and built environment- across public affairs in local government- property comms, community engagement + political liason for local gov
Morrisons- expanison programmes
Would be very interested in branching out
Healthcare- not necessarily crazy about
Lexinton knows are similar to camargue- but not sure does it better
Would want to move to a different agency/ larger agency - edleman- Bell Pottinger
Good position on project atm- a lot of client exposure with good learning curve- lot of responsibility at junior
Working with 3 clients and 12 projects
£23,000k

Speaking May
Portland and Edleman
3moths
EXPERIENCE

Account Executive
Camargue
November 2011 – Present (1 year 4 months)

Assistant Director
The Oxford Imps
October 2009 – July 2011 (1 year 10 months)

Intern
JWT
August 2010 – August 2010 (1 month)

contact-comment:
Comments: JE - Intverviewed 05/03/15

Joined Hume Brophy - in a London - did pr initially then built the PA practice with his background from Brussels 
Built the uk PA client list - if you look at where it was for years ago and where it is, they have been his wins. 
There are 10 in PA, grown from nothing - Hume Brophy
25 in total in London in Hume Brophy 
Grown over 40% in 2014-2015

Works on clients internationally - 80 people total across the group. Offices in London, Dublin, Singapore, Paris and Brussels
5 MDs across the business plus the 2 x founders 
20 clients in PA now 
Sectors; FS, food and agric, health, TNT, transport, energy 

Sounds very interesting. 

FS is a big part of Hume Brophy's turnover. PA - within that FS is a substantial part. Energy, broadcasting and aviation and transport and tech/TMT. PR is more focused on FS.

60: PR 40: PA

he doesnt feel he's easily sellable as he's young, have to work with him to see how good he is. Need to have a lot of vision to get it. That's why he's stayed there as they get him

likes the agency, heard great things, likes the set up 

On an equity scheme and they are growing faster than Lansons in his eyes. been there a while and knows the territory. Getting a stake in the business

he doesnt think they would like him. he wants to progress with Hume Brophy. he would burn bridges if he went to another agency

he's on £100K+

contact-comment:
Comments: 06 Nov 2014 09:10 JB: Finsbury - Client Meeting
100 in London office

How do you manage talent?
Volume of roles per year?
Key challenges in rec
Recruiting strategy & Relationships with Partner Agencies

2014 Homes Report winner - top agency
Recent clients:
- Astra Zeneca
- Green King
- Col Com

International network, global footprint Roland Rudd - Senior Partner & Founder Entrepreneurial feel - lean structure, open to ideas & trying new things

Areas:
Fin Comms & IR
Corp Affairs

Teams cover all areas alongside digital teams (have a basic understanding e.g. Twitter) Attention to detail is key - a lot of FTSE work

Work hard, big, intense global clients - key issues.
No to regularity, standard in-house feel, or hand holding - rather a pragmatic/ results approach.
Pro bono work with communities
Global clients - across offices
IPO & M&A work

Wants Associate level
Top Academics - from normal 2.1 + or 2.2 and above Do a lot of work under time pressure - exam like! Russell Group Universities.
Bath & St
Not to UWE or University of Westminster

Teams:
PR
Reg - led by Will Turner

Work across teams - specialism in an area & other areas IR, media relations, digital

Skeleton staff over Xmas

Send: CVs to all three - Katie, Keryn and Laura ** MUST PUT CANDS NAME & JOB TITLE IN SUBJECT **

Candidate name in email title
Sal. On & LF
Notice Period
Permission to work in UK
Sponsorship license - but complicated in EU to do it.

NB on fee notice with invoices

If they are Journalists - float name over before sending

Interest in media & news is key!! Big campaigns. Must follow big issues in trade press.

3 (poss 4 stage)
Katie involved
Senior Partner at final

Test
Write under time pressure - press summary / advice letter

One lady off to Dubai
Going in house LT project - poss come back Both perm

Associate level
Coming in - need to reflex both sides
This building is odd

Hoping for a NEW YEAR start date.

Entrepreneurial - interested in business.
Self starter, make an impact
Introvert than extrovert
Industrials team - big characters
Confident but not arrogant
Team players
Wholesome, well rounded
Thinking independently but working collaborative Integrated b/w teams Competitive nature.
Hard working

Friday - drinks, dress down - professional but fun culture.

Contact: Email best generally. Send CVs to all.

contact-comment:
Comments: Allidura (Permanent Vacancy x1)
We are looking for someone with around 6-8 years experience who has both an ethical and consumer background.

The role will work within the current team of 9, more specifically within the Health Marketing team, where we’re looking for a new team member who has a consumer background (more specifically, if possible a nutrition background) as well as a strong ethical background that would allow them to focus on providing more scientific council for the team and the client. The role is a true PR role working in partnership with the client to find solutions for their brands and will work across a range of activities including working on the client marketing and brand strategies, reaching out to the media, logistical planning.

The salary for this will be around £50k dependent on skills and experience of candidate.

contact-comment:
Comments: 03 Mar 2015 19:05 JB: Meeting Notes:

Jess Bond

Last year wasted £40k on rec
Had 2 people they brought in last year who didn't work out
IH - didn't work
Pub Affairs - set up PA offering but as need died down 

Finding rec hard
Small company - attraction hard
JB set Bondy up 7 years ago
Was the MD Corp at Ketchum b/w 2005 - 2007 - won BSKYB as a client

Brought over Sony, BSkyB, FedEx to Bondy
Small agency of the year awards - stopped trying to win award Clients with senior stakeholder engagement

Time Management key: system she uses is:
Green time - delivery
Yellow time - help to achieve Green time 
Red time - waste of time

Corp & Consumer
One team with clients
Expensive service, highest quality
Senior level contact
Cash rich business - doing well - financially stable
Won First Utility from Grayling - largest energy supplier - senior stakeholder contact

2 x Ass Partners
Crisis and Issues
Regional Broadcast 

Team & Levels: Dir / AssD/ AM/ SAE/ AE / Exec Ass

Strong CC - with Tech b/g (ideally an understanding of Energy)
Smart individual
Needs a good No.2
Someone who can pitch a story and get it in the papers - whether its The Sun ot The FT.
Win biz - and then service it properly.
Delivery of service
Hands on, doer!
Media relations - Dan Jones  - strong media relations / know journalists

Ideally a guy! 
Good communication
Delivery/ Service clients
Just gets it...gets PR....gets CC

Pick up a brief
Consultant - 360 degree
TV
Opinion piece
Top level strategy
Corp Comms
Not Consumer - fluffy product related PR type - “coat hanger stuff”
May have a campaigning background

Smart, bright
Analytical
Write well
Gets it!
Respected our clients
Gravitas
Thought and diligent

Intellect “elk” - Corp/ Tech/ Public Affairs Understand tech

Wants to stay lean and mean - high quality client service
Could offer a profit share

Add different dimention
Reputation
Could be 30-35 yrs

From Agency - SAM, AD, SAD, ASS D
Other agency: 1 month not seen anyone!!
Likes FTI, MHP
Person: Values, Humble, Honesty, Integrity, Kind, Believe in the values, Autonomy, Work directly with senior clients, Dedicated, Passion and interest for CC, not synical. 

Timelines: ASAP

Current clients: Nandos, Freemasons, First Utilities, milk company - Aus; new business

Don't do social media - interested in some exposure to this. Currently outsourced. 

One of her competitor agencies (she knows the MD) have just taken on a highly intelligent girl - from MHP - at AD level - she gets it, is hugely credible with clients and doing fantastically well !!! She’s only 28.

Sal: up to £100k

Corp Comms - Tech or Energy (will she take one or other?)
Tough brief - v specific.
This person won’t grow trees.

contact-comment:
Comments: Lovely lady. Used to work at Ballard Assoc, bought by Trimedia, bought by Grayling. 

Cordelia's background: CC and financial PR (Brunswick), IH, then Ballard Assoc, HH'd by a lady who set up on her own (IF Comms) - she headed up the London office there. First exp of running a business, loved it. Tech and Venture, heavy mobile focus.

Sold IF Comms to Hotwire in Nov 2011. Went to Hotwire for 6 mths - not for her. Lots of Hotwire clients went with her - Hotwire were angry.

Expects to sell the business at some point - not sure when. She's all set for bedding into a lareger agency as part of her acquisition. She knows a lot about acquisitions and how they work.

Fieldhouse: focus on enterprise tech and investment, really cool tech, mobile, digital companies. CC, product, cons, digi offering. Fieldhouse is all about taking businesses to the next step, the impact they can have on the business, not just a nice to have. Work with investment, angel groups, VCs and investor programmes. Anything below AiM at the moment - raising their profile as companies and as individuals, supporting their portfolio - GREAT new business avenue.

More new bus than knows what to do with. Currently hiring. 14/15 clients. Team is 4 ppl but lkg to hire another 2 asap. 3 big clients about to start. No office - based out of the Adam Street Club/WFH. Lkg at getting an office.

Just had best qtr - about £100K per qtr in revenue. 2 years old - launched in April 2012. 

Structure: (AMs and an AssD - noone is super junior)
MD
Snr Assoc
Assoc
Jnr Assoc

Personally wants a stake in it and hands-on involvement and to grow and develop it once acquired. The cash upfront would be helpful she admits. She has been approached three times.

Happy to have a coffee with Grayling to discuss further - would like to chat about money and multiples at that stage

contact-comment:
Comments: From: Gay Collins [<mailto:Gay.Collins@mhpc.com>] 
Sent: 29 January 2015 15:24
Subject: Gay Collins New Details

Following the email I sent to some of you before Christmas (and perhaps this week in which case this will be a duplicate, so apologies), I have now left MHP and the email addresses gay.collins@mhpc.com <mailto:gay.collins@mhpc.com> and gayc@penrose.co.uk <mailto:gayc@penrose.co.uk> will no longer be active from the end of this week.

Should you wish to contact me, please email  gay@gaycollins.co.uk <mailto:gay@gaycollins.co.uk>  or call my mobile, which is the same as before (07798 626282)

I will continue to be actively involved in the 30% Club, so please continue to use these email tags  30PercentClub@mhpc.com <mailto:30PercentClub@mhpc.com> and 30percentPR@mhpc.com <mailto:30percentPR@mhpc.com> 
as these will come through to gay@gaycollins.co.uk <mailto:gay@gaycollins.co.uk> . Please also use that address for anything relating to my Non Executive Directorship with JP Morgan Overseas and my role with Cancer Research UK’s Women of Influence Board.

If you’d like to contact anyone at MHP and you don’t have a specific person’s name apart from me, please email contact@mhpc.com <mailto:contact@mhpc.com> or call switchboard on 0203 128 8100

This email is going to a broader contact list than before, as I thought I'd combine this with a tidy up of my Outlook contacts, so some of you will be friends or suppliers, in which case ignore all the work references!   If you would like to be removed from any updates from me, or from MHP, please do respond so I can remove you from this list (and apologies for disturbing you..)

Best regards

Gay

Gay Collins
Executive Chairman
MHP Communications
Email: gay@gaycollins.co.uk <mailto:gay@gaycollins.co.uk>

contact-comment:
Comments: 22 Oct 2014 14:20 JB: Notes taken from his LI profile

I specialise in communications advisory work in M&A, Corporate Positioning, Competition & Regulatory situations. I have experience across industry sectors, and am now focused on Telecoms, Media & Technology,

Experience:
Brunswick Group
Partner
June 2004 – Present (10 years 5 months) London

I am head of Brunswick's global Technology, Media & Telecoms advisory practice. Brunswick is a corporate and financial public relations agency, based in London with offices around the world. 
We specialise in strategic communications, particularly involving corporate reputation campaigns and corporate activity such as mergers, acquisitions, capital raisings and crisis management.

I also have a strong interest in developing London as a global technology centre. I provide mentoring advice to start ups based in the East London technology cluster, chair a working group on Capital & Investment as a member of the Tech London Advocates, and sit on the advisory board of Silicon Valley Comes to the UK. I am also a judge on the McKinsey Venture Academy for young entrepreneurs

Comments: Meeting JS and KS:


Gmtv started as colleague 13. Startup then. Liked the experience. Broadcast and editorial for 3 years. 

Worked for ITN next working in Westminster. 1.5 years across regions. Set up a news gathering journalism operation, ran that for a few years.

Barclays for 5 years. Group Head of Media. Started at Balfour a year ago. 

IR, media, comms, marketing, employee comms, policy - team

Business unit comms 
Marketing 
Media Rels
Employee Comms 
Business Comms

Edelman on small retainer, Tulchan for financial work 

Employee comms is the most important. Marketing next. 

34,000 staff. U.K.: 17,000,

1.7/1.8 market cap

Media manager just hired. Gill. Hiring a grad. 

Mix of skills and trees. Comms has to be the conscience of the organisation. Their ppl need to challenge. 

competitors CVU, Ringway Jacobs,
