contact-comment:
Comments: 04 Feb 2015 12:49 JB: CLIENT MEETING NOTES - JB & JE met Matt Ridsdale at the Tavistock offices.
Matt Ridsdale

Independent firm, privately owned - 25 years old - board Partnership - option scheme - internal membership in shares


New partner arrangement and new title structure across the business:
NOW: Associate, Consultant, Ass D, Director

Associate - up to 2 years experience - £24-25k 10-20% bonus 
Consultant - bulk of people at this level - £33-75k 
Associate director - on programme to be on the board and equity partner - waiting to join the board - £75-100k 
Director - on board - broad range - stakeholder (equity)  £100+
27 people currently - grow to 50 in 2-3 years 

Pay people quite well - 
Bring In an options scheme to try and get everyone to benefit
25 years history - John and Loulou - started the business 

High quality companies, spend more with them, stay longer 
Less focused on AIM companies now 
Those of who spend £50k + is where they want to focus 

Matt built a corporate practice - doing corporate affairs but not lobbying 

Might need to hire 3 x consultants at £40-60k level
Will always hire people who can bring a book or build a practice in a new sector 

Telco, property and mining - three core areas 
Recognise they need to build reputation in the mkt in other areas 
Likes people from small firms 

Fix - differentiate - grow 
3-7 years some churn 
No churn at senior level 

Informal first interview, happy to know on what basis we have been speaking to them.

Smart people, could be academic but might not be Oxbridge. Likes super-smart: academic, bright, switched types.
Training programme - New scheme 

Jeremy Carey
Lulu Bridges
And 6 others
John West - remains a shareholder
Quarterly firm updates - 45 mins Q&A
Credit where credit due
Matt - 30
Jos - 34

Business - high quality, spend more, stay longer.
AIM market - going larger, bigger clients
No to below £30k fees to a min of £50k (quality) up to £250k fees - over 5 years.

FTSE 100
3 deals - plus 1B with 6 fig fees
Growing average fees and providing a better service
6 months plus in deals, no quick wins

REC: No current needs - to reshuffle and then assess
Tavistock - traditionally Fin PR but Matt's b/g in Corp Comms Strong Cap Markets & IR Corp Comms - reg/ strategic advise/ regulatory (non-political lobbying)

Need to fill in mid 2015:
- 3 x consultants (40-60k)

Run accounts
Can do 80-90k and wants to run a Practice - head a division

Like a Pendomer or Vigo, may struggle 

Telco/ Property / mining main sector b/g - bought conduit

More of an unknown brand rather than a bad brand

No digital

No. at FTI ( dead man's shoes)
Bidducks (KTZ) Ed Bridges at FTI
OR
10 Man band - done 3/4 years - wants more

27 in total - started with 12 - always been 30 (thereabouts) Keen to growth to 50 - but grow profitably Growth in the right way

This year - similar to last year - same revenue & profit Churn and things take time AIM to add 3 - win the right kind of work
3 year
Fix book, increase service offering, increase revenue and head count 

Good retention rate?
Comes and goes in waves
Don't lose people at Board level
At 3-7 years - career sticking point -tend to lose. That's fine to lose at that level.

FTI and Instinctif come along unstandable if they go. Fine.

COO - Axel Tan

Key: speed of decision making - can be made by Matt & Jos Move from initial meet to offer - within 2 weeks

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NotesId: 725101-6321-1535


Note: ---------------------------------------------------
28.11.2013 chat: Personal email - mattridsdale@yahoo.co.uk

A lot of companies wouldn’t pay as much Tavistock - he knows that but is open to the right opp.

Basic currently: £110K. Bens: health, private medical, pension. Bonus: £10K in 2012 (he got the biggest bonus as they don’t do it). He’s an option holder over 5% of the company (less than price of a new golf) - and a commitment of an additional 5% - has an ownership position at the agency.

Heads up TMT team - but his new brief/role at Tavistock is (he’s on Exec Committee) to work across all sectors.

First job in FPR. He runs a team of - he does 60% corp and 40% FPR - he’s done lots of deal and M&A work, issues and crisis. He’s devt the corporate practice at Tavistock more.

New biz, writes strategy, gets team up and running, then acts as senior client advisory. Crisis comms (currently for a bank), just pitched for a Global Investment Bank (6 fig), just won a Govt Rels brief for a leading Telco. 

Clients: Vodafone (Group UK). Virgin Media. A $20m Bank client. Kakom (FTSE250) Telco. High net worth clients. Corp/entre/philanthropy

Crisis: the bank brief is a crisis brief, litigation support, Saudi bribes situation

Porter Novelli does appeal and he’s int in talking to them - unconventional, different. He wants to become a better operator, more experience, working with new people

He enjoys what he does and loves the people - but doesn’t want to replicate/like-for-like move

He’s under 30!!! Done so well - won an award in 2013 - he’s sending me the info


A Director of Tavistock, Matt specialises in the TMT sectors. He has advised some of the best known brands in the industry from mobile operators to broadcasters, from ISPs to the backers of newspapers and the owners of radio stations. 

Matt has led many campaigns promoting international business brands, supporting fundraisings and corporate transactions including IPOs, mergers, acquisitions and disposals. He has extensive experience of advising clients through hostile situations and reputational crises both within TMT and beyond in banking, defence and manufacturing.

* joined Binns Co in 2003, spent 2.5 years advising small cap companies
* joined Tavistock in 2005 as a Manager. Became youngest ever board director of firm in 2008
* head up TMT at Tavistock since 2008, now joint largest contributor to revenue by sector
* joined newly formed executive committee at Tavistock (Chairman, CEO and me) in 2011
* extensive experience of working with top management and high profile individuals
--- Neil Berkett, Virgin Media
--- Strive Masiyiwa, Econet Wireless Rockefeller Foundation Trustee
--- Denis O'Brien, Digicel
* broad experience of ECM and Debt Markets >$15bn+ of bond issues, >20 IPOs/fundraisings
* crisis experience includes advising Anglo Irish Bank through nationalisation
* voted as one of the most influential City PRs in City Am Survey of Business Eds (nationals and broadcast) 2013
* M&A experience includes advising Virgin Media on $23.3bn sale to Liberty Global

Comments: Meeting Notes - 6th October 2014 - JE

Are thinking possibly of people form 3rd sector, pharma, other areas of heakthcare. Or people involved in self-care. 
Would like the the process to be done before Christmas - start date of 1st March ideally. 

Happy for all the cost to be in the year - better for their budgets

They would like people with a breadth of experience in healthcare - they may also have some people that they wikk throw to us.

2 stage process 
Matthew and Helen intially
Carlton as 2nd stage - possibly a presentation 
Thinking £80,000-£100,000 salary 


Meeting Notes - 15th Sept 2014 - JE 

Claire farmer - Comms Officer
Libby Whitaker - PA Officer
Gopa Mitra - Director of health policy and public affairs -replace 
Helen carrycot - director of legal and regulatory affairs 

Pzier, Glaxo, Novartis, heart uk, Ramsey healthcare 
OTC awards 
Weber, red door, Virgo 
Roche, Mundipharma

ABB, Lansons, nestle, Hanover
£75-80k 

Pagb

Represent branded OTC and food supplements 
3 things; 
1. Self regulatory regime - founded 1919 -self regulatory body - all medicines 
2. Try and make the environment as well as possible 
3. Policy - pushing the self care agenda to help relieve pressure on healthcare sector and help drive sakes to members 
- got a research company to help push this as it's not happening. Eightycarney review 

Work closely with Myra and eu

Trying it regulate the e cigarette industry 
Get the self care up the agenda 
Consumer campaign - with NHS England - look after yourself 

Team of 2 - 
Comms is currently focused on members - well Informed. And advised
Possibly getting more coverage 

Might be a more PA role 
Might be a more comms role 
Good network in the space but may need help 
Need to fu sloes the JD and and him some examples

Policy at ABPI - in ex
OTC background ideal - 
Budgetting - and terms 
End of December 2014

PA - self care forum - good at OTC - bog ambitious 
Claire - not as proactive good comms - very loyal 
Management experience 

Regulatory role
Pharmacist - industry regulatory role - OTC then come into here 

Proactive - engaged to drive agenda 
Bright - engaged 
Personal drive abs ambition 
Proposal - policy side

Comments: Client meeting - Mindshare analytics - Skander
Business planning 
Upcoming projects with bigger data sets, on programming sets
Tech and size of data sets
Typical profile purely economics rations, big data 
Specific skill set in data very interested
Big gap in text analysis. More involved in twitter, make sense of text
Read sentiment 
Someone from a start up who has done text analysis in the past
Room for junior people as well as experienced
His background is consulting in oil and gas. Moved towards telecoms, US and Africa. Focused 5 yrs in analytics, driving strategy, background maths
Quant analytics and predictive modelling 
Basic skills, what he looks for Ian good anayits
Exp in a start up, no requirement in terms of company size. Some client facing 
Need to develop tools to be used across the company, RND type mentality, not necessarily consulting before. Programming, python, keenness to develop this part of his skill set don't use amazon a lot yet 
Hadoop skills be great
Exp in mahout data mining algorithm, gap in that at the moment
Commercial focus good, can monetize analysis, commercial purpose broken down UK focus and worldwide focus analys planning team
Composed of about 15 ppl different levels all expert in modelling, some client facing, some running the models. 4 or 5 with different technologies, runni data science projects 
Building the team, tech skill set first and foremost
For him bit of coordination across group M, bit of travel with that. Standardise
Giovannis team is worldwide, UK team can be global mostly Uk centric
Requirement for more jar people to start, and some with a few yrs with a specialism (3/4 yrs) diversity of skills essential

contact-comment:
Comments: 07 Oct 2014 10:28 JB. Spoke to Oliver - smart, clear, direct, professional (OP at Portland will like).

German- English (bi-linginual) British & German parents.
Based in London - been working in London for 16 years.

Was: 70% FPR (no calendar work, mainly IPO and M&A work) ; 30% CC -- now more 50/50.

2/3 months - as a Director at Got promoted up to part of the CNC Senior Management Team.

IH preference or very interesting agency (with growth) - either Tier 1 (Finsbury or Brunswick) or Tier 2 (new challenge)

Sal: £105k basic & high bonus payments & 30% - £135 - 150k package (depends on the performance across the year).

LF:
Grow something and be involved to support Strategic picture on the firm - direction.
Interesting situations/ interesting clients
Entrepreneurial - driving new biz, presenting the firm in the market outsdie of DAX, presenting CMC outside - worked with Finsbury & Bell Pott.
Now is the point where he stays or goes. Been at CNC for 8 years - feels time to move in.

Re Portland:
Good name
Aware they have been lookig for Fin support with Corp Mandates.
Interesting opportunity.
Concerns: not sure if he'd get the support from the wider agency...? Thinks they might need more than one head in Fin PR (maybe 3).

Knows Steve, know Tim - interesting characters and likeable
OM has coll
Eye to C suite etc - not having to communicate to junior level
Money not the main driver - could achieve £120-125k base & bens & bonus at CNC within a year.
Drive would be the challenge, growth, working with interesting, intelligent people in a mature, profressional environment.

Was on hols in Crete back next w/c 13th but keen to meet for coffee upon his return.
Requested I email over the Portland JD and said he'd come back to me over the next day or two. I mentioned my deadline for this Friday. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

02.04.14 chat: nothing changes since he chatted to Gwen. He joined Rio Tinto in Mongolia in Jan -Sept 2013, lkg after the comms of their mine out there. Rejoined CNC straight afterwards. Running London office as he did before. 

Getting married in June 14.

7 years a CNC, he's a generalist and likes that. Initially he was focused on IPOs, M&A etc. Then made an active move out of just doing just FPR and started doing more crisis, rep mgt. Mix of CC and FPR. 15 ppl in office, direct report of 6. Hans on practitioner. Involved in D2D work. Int'l element as bought by Publicis 1.5 years ago. 

German focus at CNC. he speaks German

Lkg at IH as enjoyed the IH opp in Rio. 

Strong team with good senior ppl.

£90K basic. 20% bonus yearly. Ben - hcare, gym, car allowance. 5% of rev of whatever he brings in

He knows Portland very well and knows a snr person there. Likes what Portland are doing.

Known as a Senior Consultant (Dir) at CNC

contact-comment: Comments: Nick heads up the RLM Finsbury Middle East operations. He joined RLM Finsbury in 2011 after 15 years in the global private equity and investment banking industry. Nick was previously a Managing Director and fund manager with a Dubai-based private equity group focusing on investments across the Middle East region. Prior to working in the Middle East, Nick co-led the management buy-out of part of Deutsche Bank’s private equity funds management business in Australia into an independent funds management company. Before joining the private equity industry Nick worked in Deutsche Bank, London and New York within the global strategic planning and corporate development group. During this time Nick worked on many of Deutsche Bank’s global acquisitions, investments, joint ventures and strategic initiatives. Nick studied business studies at Trinity College, University of Dublin, Ireland and at the Université Libre de Bruxelles, Belgium.

contact-comment:
Comments: LI profile summary:

Pamela has been providing Investor Relations support and market intelligence to client Investor Relations and Executive Management teams, predominantly in the Services, Industrial & Pharmaceutical sectors.

Pamela is effective at analysing business issues and solutions and supports and works closely and collectively with other Senior Managers to make a strategic and commercial contribution to the business.

Within the last year Pamela has successfully transformed the IR team and created a core operational outlet from Capita’s Polska centre to support the client facing consultants of the London based team. Pamela has driven the transformation of the London team into a value added consultancy business. 

Pamela has demonstrated the improvement of daily and monthly revenues by focusing on the provision of service. Working closely with the Business Development teams to focus on opportunities to offer our clients a more tailored service, specific to the needs of Investor Relations professionals.

A proactive leader, highly motivated and positive.

contact-comment:
Comments: Summary
Internationally educated and speaking 5 languages (English, French, Spanish, Japanese & Russian), I seek a professional challenge in a multi-cultural & lingual environment, using strategy, diplomacy and networking to achieve a project's goal.

Specialties:
Virtual team management, knowledge management, Interactive brand initiatives, Offline-Online tranversality, cross-cultural communication, competitive analysis, team training, share & reapply, CMS usage for website development

Experience

International Program Coordinator & Account Manager
Proximity BBDO 
(Public Company ; 1001-5000 employees ; Marketing and Advertising industry)
June 2006 - Present (2 years) 
• Strengthening and structuring the role of the EMEA & APAC Proximity network for the client P&G with strategic contributions, workflow process management and logistics management
• Strategic & operational development of a multi channel CRM program (reach: over 13 MM strategic targets)
• Co-leading the deployment across W.E. & China of the online technical platform via an in-house CMS; training the network; creation & updating documentation; benchmarking; performance review; recommendations
• Accountable for network sustainability; implementation of best practices; and for “share more, reapply more”
• Co-Lead project manager for 4 P&G brands on their on/offline pan European initiatives (client sell, SOW, storyboards, creative briefing; maintenance mngt) 
• Weekly travel, either for internal network development and/or for P&G client facing
• Client: Procter & Gamble

Strategic Manager
Palla Koblinger Proximity Austria 
(Privately Held ; 51-200 employees ; Marketing and Advertising industry)
January 2006 - May 2006 ( 5 months) 
• Strategic contributions and creative orientations for a pan-European advertising campaigns
• Active participation in the creative brief groundwork and development of the media agenda
• Clients: Western Union Bank; Toyota

Marketing Manager Trainee
Sceti Co.ltd, Tokyo Japan 
(Privately Held ; 51-200 employees ; Import and Export industry)
June 2003 - January 2004 ( 8 months) 
• Managed communication and business transactions with suppliers and clients for SCETI and NBKK
• Established two joint venture partnerships with pharmaceutical and liposome partners 
• Administered a 6 MM JPY budget for optimization of internal infrastructure 
• Research and negotiation for potential product distribution rights& exclusivity on Japanese soil

contact-comment:
Comments: Lkg now as wants to go back into a pure PR agency. See other log notes.

Currently on £120K but as he's a ptr at TA, he doesnt get any bens and pays himself. It's more about the opp/role than the £££. Wants north of £100K though.

FPR mainly with CC second. Currently does 70% IR and PR, 30% other stuff. His current role has three disciplines:
1. providing PR & mktg advice to clients raising cvapital for fundraisers - energy, digi, tech, real estate - raising profile, website help, biz advice, PR
2. Help clients with their mktg of fundraising - Pure IR
3. Biz Devt - intros to clients peer group

Int'l mainly but will do UK and int'l. Worked out in Saudi for 9 mths on largest ever IPO £25bn - Kingdom Holding - Giles Sanderson went for it and lost. He was asked to work on the project by the Prince. he worked on nyumerous other M&As and IPOs whilst in ME and taught/educated the Weber team out there.

Left Weber due to boss not giving him the rewards for his work. Thames Advisory were a client and talked him into going - in hindsight, he should have gone to another agency!

No to Finsbury, Brunswick, FTI, College Hill, Bell Pott, Cititgate - tioo stuffy. Likes Powerscouert - chatting to Nick Lambert who's a mate of his at Powersct.

Wants juicy int' role in agency, int'l and UK ideally, IR and PR role - he's got his head into a move, he's not being challenged now or learning from ppl he respects, he wants full PR role, needs ppl to have integrity, FPR heavy ideally. Would go IH - IR financial company preferred or corp comms IH role.

New biz - loves, can do, can't bring biz with him tho.

contact-comment:
Comments: 11 Mar 2015 15:59 JB: Spoke to Jeremy Lucas - AssD at Blue Rubicon

Leads the client work for Coca-cola (2nd largest client); McDonalds - flagship client; Lawn Tennis Association; Sainsbury’s - before they dropped them for Tesco.
Also does a lot of media training with the likes of British Gas, Shell, McDonalds
Blue Rubicon tough act to follow as a agency.
Sits across Corp Comms across Consumer brands (mainly FMCG clients)
Blue Rubicon - considered by many as the best in the business.

Thinking about his next career move - ‘right’ next move.
Has an offer on the table currently - not sure if it’s right. From a large WPP clients - Director in Corp (second in command) - been made a verbal offer a few weeks back but the longer they take to put the offer together the more reservations he has.

Other ops:
Was offered a Director role at Cohn & Wolfe & Good Relations in the past 2 years. Turned both down for different reasons. Thought about both roles since and wonders now whether career-wise a move earlier would been better for his progression.

Very flat structure at Blue Rubicon
Director level or Managing Director doesn’t have that at BR - you’re either on the board (with shares) or you’re not. JL has been told he’s on-track to get their but timescales are tbc.

LF:
Wants to retain working with quality clients
Integrated offering across disciplines
Autonomy and Responsibility across the business (including resp for the P&L)

Sal: £86k plus bonus (8-10%) and an excellent benefits package.
LF: £100k plus bens.

Sounded keen on WB, PR Partner role - sending spec and awaiting thoughts with CV to follow.

Mobile: 07946610727
Email: jeremylucas_@hotmail.com

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Financial Communications Consultant with 14 years of experience working with both private and public companies on a broad range of communication projects. Interested in developing strategic communications plan for companies from pre-IPO preparation through to the full gamut of FPR projects once listed including; media profile development and crisis management.

Specialties:Communication Audits, Initial Public Offerings, Financial Calendar Programmes, Profile Development Strategies

Nicola joined Buchanan in 1998 having previously worked in New York on a commercial and political risk marketing project at the insurance firm, Sedgwick (now Marsh). Since 1998 in addition to working on a wide range of ongoing financial communications programs, Nicola has advised on several IPOs and both agreed and contested deals.

contact-comment:
Comments: 01 Jul 2015 11:35 JB: Met with David Flynn
Good guy, well spoken
If agency - would need to be a larger, challenging agency.
Been the client at Pinsent Masons - had 3-4 agency
Loves issues rich / crisis work - Eulogy (consumer client) narrative Mis-can  (owners of Branston pickle).
Strategy, statements prepared, senior counsel advice, issues.
Would get bored if the Client Partner was just keeping an engine running. 
Met Adrian Chitty - Hope & Glory - Partner
Heading up Comms for Cabinet Office (no.2 in Cabinet Office) Civil Service - £64k - £119k banding Want person in post by next few months Is Immediately Avail
Availability for interview - pretty good This week: 12 - 2pm; Fri clear
Next: any expect Wed
Roles:
- Cabinet office
- MSL
- Law firm - Head of Comms (had previous incumbent for 14 years). Doing some consultancy work. 
Has a final round interview - with Cabinet Office
MSL ON HOLD - AGREED WE CAN REVISIT MSL CLIENT DIRECTOR ROLE IN 10 DAYS DEPENDING UPON HOW THINGS PAN OUT WITH THE CABINET OFFICE ROLE.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Was at Eulogy until May - was on the board at Eulogy. Decided to step away from Eulogy - and resigned.
Very good relationship with Adrian - MD at Eulogy.
Head of Comms role at The Cabinet Office (one of 3 at final stage). Party conference next month.
If another agency would want to be a lot more Corporate.
Eugolgy hired a new MD in December 2014.
Good at likes strategy, issues management, relationship management skills, building business contact/ relationships. 
Been a client - so understands how a client works and what they expect.
Keen to on the MSL Client Director role.
Meeting to discuss the role - tomorrow at our offices at 10.30am
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
11 Mar 2015 10:15 JB: SPOKE TO David Flynn
David is actively looking at his options atm
Had a chat with his MD at the start of the year and explained to her that his heart lies in IH and he wants to leave. She understood and David’s leaving on good terms. Leaving Euology at the end of April. Still on the board until April and may do some consultancy work thereafter until he finds a new role.
Euology hired Phil Ball last year (who also sits on the board already). DF doing a hand-over. Euology have a high-flying experienced AD in the business who will also be stepping up and taking on some of his work.
Is interested to hear about IH roles only - NOT TO ANOTHER AGENCY!
Looking at options currently and INTERVIEWING....
HTC - Head of Global Corp Comms (2nd int stage) + another role.
When are Pinsents was doing an international role. Not wanting to go back to law - NO - done that!
Ambitious. Wants a meaty International Corp Comms role - open on sector
Sal: on £90k base plus gets a % of divisional and business revenue. 
Would be looking for £90-100k
Ready to jump into a new role as soon as the ‘right’ one comes along.
Happy to KIT re IH roles
Emailed - updated CV en route.
Will also providing shouts for any recommendations.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sell in...
Please find attached CV for David Flynn for the Head of B2B PR role - this is the guy I was telling you about on Friday, he is a bit of a wildcard in terms of his experience but after meeting with him I was impressed with him and thought he had the gravi
NotesId: 725475-7027-15181


Note: tas and creative thinking that you are looking for.  

He is very passionate about technology and most of his clients in his current agency are within the tech space so he has a good grasp of this space.  He is a seasoned B2B PR professional having worked both agency and client side for global law firms and has that truly global thinking that is needed for this role. 

He got approached by Eulogy! to set up their professional services division which he has done very successfully and although he is not actively looking he is keen to get back into a large corporate, an environment that he misses.

Candidate Name	David Flynn  	
Candidate Location (Are you able to commute to your office location daily or are you considering relocation?)	South East London  Yes happy to commute 	
Current Job Title	Head of Professional Services 	
Current Company	Eulogy! 	
Current Package  (To include base, bonus/commission, car/car allowance, fuel card and any other benefits, if business development please detail sales OTE, targets etc - as much detail as possible)	 Base salary: £70,000  New Business bonus based on fee income  Healthcare Pension   Laptop/phone 	
Current Notice Period	3 months notice  	
Salary/Package Expectations	£70,000 plus benefits 	
Are you legally able to work in the job location, do you require a work permit? 	Yes legally able and no work permit required	
Additional Information (please use this space to supply any additional information you feel relevant at this stage)

contact-comment:
Comments: Client meetings with Paul Hemsowrth from Retinue (managed service) and Paul Bates - Director of Comms at Genesis. 

Comms roster with Genesis recruitment via Paul Bates 

Paul joined 2 years for come team 
They use Vma, birchwood knight, Hudson, Morgan law 
12 people in team currently 
Likes commercial background people  - Thinks that agency people could be great. 

Digital Mngt and reports to the is content designer 
Media Mngt - Mandy Ryan 
PA and stakeholder officer - 84 local authority areas - parliamentary- connect
Corp Comms Mngr
Internal Comms officer - weekly brief - staff conference 1400 
Graphic designer 
Regen and growth Comms advisor (CSR)
Communities Comms advisor - quRterly magazine spotlight 

Reports to chief exec 
Merging with Thames valley - 3 people; Comms Mngr, campaigns officer and Comms officer who will be coming across. Will need to restructure the team - so needs to decide how that wil look. 

He is thinking to split into 4 areas; 
- External affairs
- External policy
- Digital
- Corp Comms

1 interview and test on same day 
Interview panel - Paul  HR, heads of service 

Restructure completed by end of May - will want to appoint by June
Could come out for new roles 
Staff conference in the autumn 

Likes; 
Young and diverse, digital, spikey that answer, people who aren't afraid to say no
Well regarded team in the org 
Close to chief exec 
Genesis Thames valley 
Often likes commercial people 
Likes people who have moved sectors and tried different things  

Flexi working 
Camden - based 
Good offices 

18% on terms 
40 days - 30 days with Genesis 
Send terms and brochures 
Invoice then

contact-comment:
Comments: 

Meeting notes 25.4.14:
Originally on the Corporate team at Freuds working on Pizza Hut, Pepsi, KFC, Carphone Warehouse. Liked the big brands but knew no different.
Moved to Bell Pott to focus on financial as pays more. Liked the smaller entrep agency feel before the MBO. Liked his boss and clients and still does but he's been there 6.5 years and wants more progression and money and has been promoised this every 6 mths and his boss has told him to wait another 6 mths and he's getting impatient. Large agency frustrations.
it's all about ££££ for Charles as he has a family and kids and wants step up.
Agency - smaller, entrep works for him - but following where the £££ is. 
He is FPR and loves it. Does a bit of CC but Cap Mkts is what he's good at. Fave part of his work. Likes being a generalist and has covered lots of sectors
Open to IH.
On £55K. No bonus last year at all but got £9K this year. Pension and health. 
Wants AssD in next agency move.

Comments: 13 Mar 2015 17:37 JB
Caught up with Jenna - is leaving NB in May (already handed in her notice).
At Board level at Nelson Bostock
Clients inc HTC, Cannon, Panasonic
Doesn't have any exposure to Pub Affairs and lobbying side.
Dealing with a massive global trade show next month.
LF: Something find inspiring and challenging
Met Alice's client last month - under NDA - suggested I liaise with Alice
Mentioned Alice had mentioned it might be worth me touching base.
Discussed the WB breif and she was genuinely interested - sent the JD & details.
We agreed to speak next week.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Been at Nelson Bostock for nearly 6 years. LOVES the agency and happy where she is. But thinks she wants more progression elsewhere. In priviledged position and can be choosy.
AssD for over a year now. Wants Board level Dir role.
Moved more towards Consumer tech recently - HTC is her main client. Canon - EMEA lanches of cameras and printers. 
Tech definitely but more consumer focused...
Int'l side - worked in France before and speaks French. US appeals as she has family in San Fran. 
Salary: £68K plus bens. Wants £75K+ to move. 6 mths notice.

contact-comment:
Comments: 25/7/13Has been in Asia for teh apst 10 years  

Was at Freuds fro 4 years 
they were about 90 ppl - so very different place then 
knew it was a love ot or hate but - they had some great people, some great clients and really enjoyed it. 
It was a case fo burn-out - knew she wouldnt have wanted to be there longer, 

Spearheaded new biz with Paul Medley 
Nescafe, Jack Daniels, Nike, Unilver,

Husband had the opp to move abroad - 
Fulford - strategic biz dev - to save the agency - rescue clients 
Enjoyed teh challenge - headed the consumer side of the business

3 year break - 2 children 

Opp to go to Edelman - singapore 
not right culturally - sraight lines, v linear 
more copr work in Singapore 
Feels this is very transferrable - break teh problem down - how you wopuld deal with a problem 

Ppl move around more there

Was approached to join fleishman 
Wanted somebody to run Visa globally - client wasnt happy 
needed to be nurtured. 
Consuemr, corporate + healthcare 

increased revenue to 2million dollars
strategic planning, weekly meetings 
leadership, meetings - installed lots of process. 
managed team of 16 - 50:50 projects and retainers. 
Very involved with international offices. 
Friendly agency - very supportive 
smart about hiring people outside of pr 

wanst opportunity and support - reports into global head. 

can see herself as a global director / managing director type of role. 

strength - client servicing
understand how to run business from an agency presepctive 
good at building trust 
good leader 
busienss development 

Creative and startegic 

always invloved in idea generation 

£150 - 175k 

Interested in Grayling and PN 
Fleishman - has set up global virtual practice 
involved in DAS - 
Always working on a global scale.

contact-comment:
Comments: So Rosanna is, clearly, the pre-eminent asset management PR in London, having run the biggest PE group Carlyle's comms and now the biggest hedge fund group, Man GLG's marketing and Comms. She also co-founded Greenbrook which, as you know, has become a successful FS agency.
She is only 32, so is not ageist, and I think will be able to give a view on Daniel's expertise. And contacts in asset management (both clients and media), as well as how she would assess him as an agency senior pitching to her (she manages 8 agencies around the world). 
My advice to him would be to 'be yourself' and not try to change too much..... I'm just struggling with his age and experience and want to get a second opinion. 

Reference from Charlie Methven at Dragon

contact-comment:
Comments: Nick is the GM of Geometry Global in the UAE having overseen the migration of OgilvyAction and the launch of the first Geometry Global Middle East office in Dubai in May 2014.
Geometry Global is the largest and most geographically complete activation agency of its kind, providing brand marketers with a unique solution for an unmet need: Precision Activation. This proprietary approach focuses on the exact blend of context and content that combine to influence consumer behavior, transforming proven communication techniques and big creative ideas into effective and profitable business growth drivers. With a team of 4000 experts in 56 markets, the global network develops highly compelling marketing programs - informed by data and insights - connecting people with brands at precisely the right times, in the right places, and right ways - making a measurable difference to clients’ businesses. Launched in June 2013, Geometry Global delivers award-winning creativity and integrated talent across a range of disciplines including Shopper, Relationship, Promotional and Experiential, Trade and Digital Marketing. Geometry Global is part of WPP.




Nick has worked with WPP and the Ogilvy group for 10 years where he has seen rapid progression from Account Manager based in London to Business Director leading the OgilvyAction team in Dubai.
Having gained a marketing degree from Bournemouth University cut his teeth in the advertising industry in Tunbridge Wells and then London working on integrated clients in categories such as automotive, tobacco, financial services, media and beverage. 

He had a desire to work in a developing market and get some international experience so in 2008 moved to Dubai to join MEMAC Ogilvy and help launch OgilvyAction, the first specialist brand activation agency in the Middle East.

Over the last 7 years the same Dubai agency has experienced incredible success and grown to a team of over 50 people. The agency has won creative awards at every international show, being recognized as the number 1 creatively awarded agency in the global network two years in a row. Nick has achieved significant new business wins and has vast client management experience including BAT, Unilever, Suzuki, Coca-Cola, The Guardian, Heineken, Audi and BP Castrol to name a few. 

He is passionate about the business, the people and thrives on building winning cultures and successful teams. He has been lucky enough to experience the best international management training experience with WPP including being selected as one of eleven globally to attend the Ogilvy Worldwide Management Conference in 2012 where he was named one of the networks ‘leaders of the future’,

Specialties - brand strategy - experiential marketing - trade marketing - shopper marketing - promotional marketing - digital activation - retail marketing

Comments: Kayode,
 
It was good to speak with you today.
 
As discussed we will be showcasing the ITSA market in a forthcoming edition of SYSTEMHOUSE.
 
Regarding SYSTEMHOUSE: 
 
SYSTEMHOUSE is a monthly publication which concisely summarises all the major financial and corporate news in the UK S/ITS marketplace - richly interspersed with Ovum Holway comment and opinion. SYSTEMHOUSE also includes summaries of the latest financial results and share price performance of over one hundred publicly quoted UK S/ITS suppliers. 
 
I have attached the February 05 edition for your perusal.
 
A 12 months subscription to System House is £495.
 
Please do let me know if you have any questions.
 
Many Thanks & Best Regards
 
Lars

contact-comment:
Comments: Profil international 
Spécialisée en communication & événementiel, diplômée du Celsa 
Expérience en Management d’équipe et de projet 
Bonne connaissance du secteur Tourisme. 


****COMPETENCES 
Management d’équipe 
Déclinaison de la stratégie de l’entreprise ; fixation des objectifs du service et individuels ; motivation des équipes ; gestion des budgets et des ressources. 

Coordination internationale 
Création, animation et professionnalisation des réseaux de communication et de congrès dans les 90 filiales du groupe. 

Gestion de projets de communication externe 
Mise en place d’événements soutenant la stratégie de communication de l’entreprise ou de ses produits, 
Négociation et développement des relations professionnelles et sponsorings. 

Développement de projets de communication interne 
Création d’un portail intranet, d’un journal interne ; valorisation des circuits d’information ; déclinaison des valeurs de l’entreprise. 


****EXPERIENCE PROFESSIONNELLE 

Octobre 2003 à ce jour : 
Responsable Adjoint Communication « Intercontinental » 
LABORATOIRE SANOFI-AVENTIS - Paris 

Coordination des activités filiales (90) en Asie, Australie, Moyen-Orient, Europe de l’Est, Afrique, Amérique Latine, afin d'assurer la cohérence des actions locales avec la politique du groupe (campagnes, plan de communication) 

Communication externe : dans le cadre du calendrier RP du groupe et des priorités produits/pays, encourager les initiatives de communication et les relations presse 

Communication interne et notamment en édition : création et mise en place d’un nouveau journal interne, « Business Link » afin de valoriser le sentiment d’appartenance à travers des articles sur les hommes, les métiers et les « success stories » (ligne éditoriale, rédaction, traduction, diffusion) 


Juin 98 à Janvier 2003 : 
Responsable du Département des Congrès Internationaux 
LABORATOIRE SANOFI-SYNTHELABO - Paris 

Management 
d’une équipe de 9 personnes (6 opérationnelles, 3 adm.) 
Planification des événements : 40 par an soit 10 000 participants / budget : 16M€ 

Relations Professionnelles 
Négociation et mise en œuvre des sponsorings avec les sociétés médicales 

Communication 
Externe / Evénementiel : mise en place d’événements soutenant la stratégie de communication : congrés, conventions produits, réunions d’experts 
Réflexion et optimisation des outils : stand, packs d’accueil, etc. 
Interne : lancement d’un portail intranet dédié à la mise en place des événements avec les filiales du groupe, et d’un projet de site extranet pour une gestion en ligne des participations 


De Mai 1986 à Janvier 1997 : 
Chef de projet au sein d’entités spécialisées dans l’organisation d’événements et de voyages 
En charge de clientèle : prospection et développement (marchés scandinaves & espagnols) 
En charge de la logistique des événements, au niveau opérationnel et administratif 
Au sein des laboratoires Sanofi et Pfizer, d’Agences événementielles et de tourisme d’affaires (Rafitours, Wingate Travel) 

Expérience à l’étranger (Etats-Unis) – 9 mois : Croisières Chandris & Agence Allied Tours N.York 

****DIPLOMES 

2004 
Maîtrise en Communication des Entreprises et des Institutions 
Celsa – Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences de l’Information et de la Communication 
Stages dans les départements Communication France et UK de Sanofi-Synthelabo 

Mémoire « L’Année de la Chine en France, entre communication culturel
NotesId: 666381-9026-7277


Note: le grand public et politique commerciale » 

****CONNAISSANCES 
Anglais et Espagnol Bilingue 
Italien Bon niveau de compréhension

contact-comment:
Comments: TAKEN FROM THE MAITLAND WEBSITE:

Rebecca Mitchell

PARTNER
Rebecca is a Partner at Maitland and has worked for the Company since 2006. She has widespread corporate and financial PR experience. Her retained clients include ICAP, the London Metal Exchange, ArcelorMittal, National Express Group and QinetiQ. She was heavily involved in communications surrounding ICAP's Libor settlement with US and British authorities in 2013.
Rebecca has particular experience in shareholder activism having advised National Express in its defence against Elliott Advisors. She has developed international media programmes, creating such programmes for GlaxoSmithKline for the European, Indian, Chinese and Japanese media.
Rebecca has worked on high profile M&A projects including the takeover of SSL International by Reckitt Benckiser; the acquisitions of Gartmore and New Star Asset Management by Henderson Group; the acquisition of OMX by Nasdaq; the acquisition of Corporate Express by Staples; and the acquisition of a stake in Rio Tinto by Chinese firm Chinalco.
Rebecca is responsible for recruitment and managing the Analysts and Consultants at Maitland.

contact-comment:
Comments: 15 May 2015 11:56 TB:

Kelly Sell in: 

Kelly Hollidge
- Bright, ambitious and polished corporate PR professional with just under four years experience at Teamspirit - where she has progressed to Senior Account Manager. Kelly enjoys being challenged and is exceptionally self motivated. 
- Kings College London educated and graduated with an Upper-second Class Honours (2:1) in History.
- Experience working across a range of financial services clients including Barclays Personal and Corporate Banking, Henderson Global investors, Close Brothers Asset Management, Standard Life Pensions and Investment and Charter Court Financial Services.
- Spent three years working with Close Brothers Asset Management as a client, cultivating the public image of Nancy Curtain who in turn became the face of the Close Brothers campaign. During this period, Close Brothers became Teamspirit’s largest account and quadrupled in size. Kelly was involved in corporate communications, reputation management and issues. 
- Drove and led the Barclays LifeSkills campaign reaching out to over one million young adults. During the process, Kelly led around table with the likes of Karren Brady. She also led a team who won recognition from David Cameron via a personal letter of thanks Teamspirit. 
- Kelly has a diverse network of media contacts across her financial services and B2C networks.
- Directly leads a team of three Account Executives with dotted line responsibilities  for an additional three staff through the matrix structure at Teamspirit. 
- Nominated by the Team Spirit CEO for shortlist of ‘PR Week 30 under 30’. 
- £37,000 base salary with a £5,000 bi-annual bonus, pension and healthcare. Two months notice period.  


 
13 May 2015 10:55 TB:
Thinking about moving recently but happy where she is. Looking for less of the press office - function which is a huge part of what she does at Teamspirit 
Big exciting campaigns peaks interests, things like crisis issue management 
Crisis issues - more interested in big clients like cocacola 
Don't want to go to something that 
Rigid movement 35 people in her office 
CNC - liked the sound of the agency if nothing else than to get a clear idea about other mid sized agencies out there 
Likes the idea of BNP Paribas and the clients listed, won PR financial campaign of the year 
Managing events would be a nice step in her next move 
Going to meet on Friday and go from there 
not 100% about moving. Lucy Caminada had a good experience about it all
Dislikes: been there a while and doesnt have authority. doesnt get on with everyone but she has a close knit group of mates and she enjoys it. A lot of perks (abroad for 2 days for xmas). But also times when she cant put up with certain ppl. She's a massive team person. Been working on same clients for 
SAE for over a year (spet 2012 promotion). In talks with line mgr re promotion / next steps. Been at Teamspirit for 2.2 years. 2nd job out of Uni.
Works on asset mgt clients - FS is fine but wants more consumer facing clients
Clients: Barclays, Standard Life Pensions, Accra credit card, CMC markets, Henderson Investment Trust, Close Bros Asset Mgt

New biz - loves pitching. Networking. Likes organic growth
Manages - one junior across her 5 a/cs. 
Likes: storytelling, social side of it, client rels
Wants AM
Salary: £26K. Got her appraisal on 30th Oct - been told they want to progress 
Med rels - LOVES LOVES LOVES this - it's her 'thing'. In charge of journalist meet and greets. Ppl come to h
NotesId: 455927-7169-15135


Note: er for sell-in strategy plans. Contacts - nat - pers finance and biz and then trade b2B and PF mags and some consumer titles
Writing - strength - done loads of. She's a content producer. Bylines and features and blog copy, releases. Did lots of Uni - did lots of journo work there - Kings College London (History)

Jean-Luc GREAU a fait toute sa carrière au MEDEF dont il a été successivement le chef des études législatives, le Directeur des études législatives puis le Directeur de l’analyse et de la recherche. Il est à ce titre l’un des meilleurs experts du Parlement français.

Jean-Luc GREAU a été à plusieurs reprises membre de section du Conseil économique et social : successivement à la section des économies régionales, à la section du travail, à la section de la conjoncture, à la section des finances.

Il est l’auteur du livre, Le capitalisme malade de sa finance paru aux éditions Gallimard (1998).

Jean-Luc GREAU est chevalier dans l’Ordre national du Mérite.

John Sunnucks is Executive Chairman of the Financial and Corporate practice. contact-comment: Comments: Edward moved to Financial Dynamics in 1994 where he took on the coordination of a global PR campaign for Odyssey Telecommunications Inc. Since then he has taken on more UK and International business, leading the IPO of Autonomy Corporation plc on EASDAQ, NASDAQ and London exchanges, the acquisition in France of Omnicom by Global Telesystems and in two large project teams, the IPO of Dimension Data and the acquisition of Mannesmann by Vodafone. In his time at FD, Edward has advised on over 21 IPOs ranging from £24m to £2bn and of varying complexity. In 2002 he led the team advising the London market’s first, and only, full information technology IPO in a three year period, Detica Group plc. His specialisations include software and IT services, IT hardware, telecommunications services and equipment and private equity. Most recently he has developed the agency’s online gaming practice which advises some of the leading players in this high growth segment. He leads FD’s team that advises Cinven, Europe’s leading private equity provider with over EUR 10bn under management.

contact-comment:
Comments: 

Louise Tingström
MANAGING PARTNER

Louise is a high-level international strategic and financial communications consultant advising a range of Euro 100 companies as well as private equity groups.
She was previously a partner at CNC Communications which she joined after 11 years at leading international firm M: Communications. At M: she headed the M&A and restructuring communications, issues and crisis management practices.  

Previously Louise was a partner at Financial Dynamics where she was responsible for specific sector and European coverage. Before that she ran worldwide corporate relations at Visa International based out of the US and international communications at British Airways. Louise also founded and ran her own financial and corporate communications consultancy – AKKA, in Paris – which became one of the foremost players in the French market.

Over the last 15 years, she has worked on mergers valued at more than €200bn and is ranked among the top 5 M&A communications advisers worldwide 2003-2015.

contact-comment:
Comments: 
Richard's on-the-ground knowledge of international business practice has been gained over 25 years working as a senior adviser inside businesses and as a consultant to the leaders and managements of some of the world's largest corporations.

From 1991 to 1995, Richard was Head of Communications at the FTSE 100 investment banking and asset management group S.G.Warburg. He then worked on secondment advising the UK Government during the final stages of its large-scale privatisation programme.
 He moved into consultancy from 1997 helping to establish and build one of London’s leading financial communications firms of the time. He founded his own firm, Holloway & Associates, in early 2003, to specialise in advising non-UK corporations and business leaders on the promotion and protection of their reputations internationally.

A decade on, in 2013 Holloway & Associates and StockWell Communications merged to bring the extensive experience and capabilities of both companies together in a new, combined firm headquartered in London and active on behalf of clients around the world.

contact-comment:
Comments: 30 Oct 2015 11:46 JB:
Spoke to Charlotte

Brunswick - have and are investing in LS 
Global team based in London
Jon Coles - Heads up! 
Investment at senior end with 3 ppl joined recently - 2 x partners (GE - is Dr; Public Health England - science writer b/g) and 1 x Director (Corp Fin b/g)
Looking at hiring at the more junior end

Academics important
Studied science degree at uni or work in sciences field
Would take someone from in or outside of Comms

Cover: Transaction, Financial Comms, Strategic Comms, Profile Raising, Thought leadership, Gov reg affairs, Corp Social Responsibility, Crisis & issues

Attract talent ->
Advisory Corp Relations firm - background in Fin Comm, Gov reg affairs, Corp Social Responsibility, Crisis & issues
International
Operate one firm globally - one p&l - integrated rather than competing internally
Not building “individual empires”
Integrated way of working

What makes Brunswick attractive?
Attractive International clients; Big issues/ stories; International opps - secondments abroad; Calibre of people - take pride in work; Strong culture - collaborative; Partnership - support for top

Charlotte - happy to see a CVs and also open to a chat

Brunswick levels:
Grad
Exec (SAE - normally at least 1 year comms exp)
AD (AM)
Associate (AD/ SAD) 
Dir (Ass Director to Director - wide band) 
Partner (Partner level)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
They would like to Virginie for a 2nd stage, they think there are 3 ppl in London that she needs to meet with
Kirstina is a no at this stage, they think she is a fantastic manager but have had a chance to sit down and what they think they need is more along the PA focussed side, someone who has had a longterm background in PA.

Janne - they think prob no, but not sure yet. again he is great and think he has great background but not sure if he is too technical for what they need right now. 

So, now they are looking for;

10/15 years experience across PA and FIG background
broad and deep understanding of FIG
combo of political/regulatory/banking background
someone who has a policy bground but also has worked in banks
FSA bground is still an interest
technological knowledge of FS is important but also being able to conduct relationships with the people in the banks and already has them there preferably.
Needs to be compelling to clients as someone who knows banking sector inside and out
having worked in and/or with banks is crucial

Comments: En 1976, Daniel Richard commence sa carrière par 4 ans au service politique de France Inter. IL rejoint ensuite RTL, pendant 2 ans, avant de revenir 10 ans à France Inter comme journaliste dans différents services. Il collabore en même temps à France 2 (1985 -1986) puis TF1 en particulier avec la direction des sports. 
Depuis plus de 10 ans Daniel Richard assure la communication de villes comme Marly le Roi, d’événements comme le Salon International du 4x4 à Val d’Isère, ou la Foire de Clermont Ferrand. Il intervient comme consultant en gestion de crise auprès d’entreprises comme Edf, SFP, Rohm & Haas, BP... entre autres. 
Daniel Richard anime également conventions et colloques sur des sujets grand public ou de communication sensible.

contact-comment:
Comments: 04 Mar 2015 11:48 JB: SPOKE TO CHRIS

Chris is an Acc Director at Rostrum in the financial services team.
Responsible for Rostrum’s financial services team - advising personal finance, securitisation and b2b financial services clients. Always worked in financial services space.
Strong network of media contacts always gets put to good use.

Exploring his options currently - but very early stages:
Internally at Rostrum - exploring a Head of Comms - but would still involve Client Services focus - top level Strategic piece.

Any new role:
Interesting client base - currently works with the likes of Legal & General (Consumer & campaigns on B2B side). Financial Services focus.
Good team - to manage and work with and lead.
Freedom to innovative, drive things , create value and create something special.

Sal: on £66k base & share options & private HC, pension. Looking for circa £80-85k & bens.
NP: 3 months

CV en route - doesn’t have one...so will need a few days to draft one.
Liverpool FC fan!

Poss for Westbourne - but issues might be sole focus in FS sector and only 8.5 years experience may be a little light!

Poss for Green Target - but question marks whether Polished or Corporate enough for GT.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Chris Tuite

Met Mark (Founder) and he was broad on board

Joined at 2 staff - now up 25

Nick Balshaw
Holly Tyzack - just left
Mark
* Chris
Fab girl in his team has taken a 6 month sabbatical 

14 Man group

Legal & Gen (retained) - mortgage, loans, pension, saving and insurance and concept research managed for 4 years - main client account - B2B and B2C Works closely withNigel Wlison (MD) of LG

to FS tech - Target Group (online mortgage Developing client HSBC - PR for first time buyers Not longer - Jason Holds - and Adrian Locock - launching his career - then moved to AXA ACP Investment

FS team - of 6
Work closely with Mark (MD)

Strategic overview - meeting targets - profitable - managing: the client, high end media, team. A lot of emphasis on managing and developing team.

New biz - done some but Mark leads on this (Chris supports on new biz) Does a lot of networking to position themselves as FS specialised

Next steps:
Either stay at Rostrum - Head of Communications role across 3 main business areas - FS/ PS/ Tech

Ready for a new challenge - feels career has stagnate 

Other opps - with other firms - not currently
F1 recruitment
Heads of agencies 

Next step - MD level role with a smaller agency
- interesting clients with the ability to go things (grow, go places, develop)
- good people, strong team
- role - wants to remain a PR specialist rather than pure new bus

- strategic, account man, lead on client accounts, some new biz
- salary also 

On £66k & company pension & HC
Depending on the role would look from £70k & bens Girlfriend works in promo and marketing

Poss agencies - like a Lansons
Level: ass d or dir

Comments: 16 Nov 2015 15:55 JB
Client Meeting with Philip Gawith:

Tim Burt and Philip Gawith set up Stockwell set up in 2010 - been running for 5 years
Merged with Holloway & Associates (Richard Holloway - Partner) in 2013
Stuck a deal with Teneo in July 2015 - Teneo have +500 ppl in US and now in the UK - Stockwell, Holloway, Blue Rubicon and Pendomer. Stockwell will be joined by the guys from Pendomer in the next 2 weeks
Flat structure: Trainee, Consultant, Director, Partner, Managing Partner
Provides at Integrated strategic partnership - where each firm "brings something to the party"
E.g. on client = Tesco. Blue Rubs work with Tesco, Stockwell have now kncked Brunswick off their perch to cover the Fin Comms. Target is to work with BR to focus on more "Consumer clients" and provide a holistic, integrated service offering.
Financial PR vs cylical vs Corp PR - busy Fin PR period are normally MARCH/ APRIL and OCT so Corp PR fills the work b/w the calendar work. (described Calender work as "heavy days b/w holidays").
Firms mainly compete against -> Finsbury, Brunswick, FTI, Tavistock (sometimes) and on one occassion Headland. Happy to see strong ppl from there! 
Stockwell are growing as a firm despite not having specific needs right now. Open to seeing great/ strong candidates....

Philip G - happy to see CVs (will include terms) 
Likes:
- ppl from the likes of Finsbury, Brunswick, FTI, Tavistock, Tulchan (poss others)
- Track record across Fin Comms - IPO, M&A and Reputation work
- Strong academic record
- "Stability on the CV" - no job-hoppers
- Successful ppl/ generally strong performers - defined strong as "someone who can hit the ground running in Fin PR, who can plug-in and play!

USPS on Stockwell :-
- Growing with real momentum in the market (proof in Teneo buy-out). Very much ON THE UP and winning business
- PG describes SW as the "CHANGE-PLAYER IN THE MARKET" providing a fully serviced, integrated offering
- Fantastic track record/ experience in Fin PR, Corp Comms and Reputation
- Reward for excellent work - pay generous bonus end of April

contact-comment:
Comments: Profile:

Chris Springham has 23 years international experience in corporate communications working all over the world, especially in the US, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. 
He began his career as a journalist with Haymarket Publishing and then worked as Marketing Manager with British Satellite Broadcasting. He was later appointed company spokesman for Mobil Corporation at its worldwide headquarters in the US, and subsequently became Communications Manager in Mobil's Europe, Africa and Middle East organisation. 
Chris then joined Rolls-Royce plc as Director of Media Relations and in 2000 led the team which delivered an award-winning response to the Concorde crash. 
At Luther, he has worked with both the public and private sectors with clients including the Department for Transport and Boeing, Reed Elsevier Group and Drax Power Ltd.
Chris frequently lectures on communications in Europe, the US and Asia. In 2005, was appointed as an External Examiner at The Media School, Bournemouth University. In 2008 he was elected as a UK Council member for the International Public Relations Association.
contact-Note:
Type: Client
Status: Active
WebSite: www.luther.com

contact-comment:
Comments: Profile

Beany joined Luther Pendragon in May 2003, from Winterthur Life, the UK life and pensions arm of the Credit Suisse Group, where she was head of external communications. Beany has over 10 years experience in the media and communications and now specialises in corporate communications, issues and crisis management, leading on a number of prominent accounts, including The Boeing Company, Continental Airlines and Drax Power Limited. 
A trained journalist, Beany has worked across a broad cross section of the media, both print and broadcast at local and national level. She has also run a number of press office functions for live events, including, heading all the communications for the Farnborough International Airshow 2004. Beany has a BEng (Hons) in Civil Engineering from Leeds University and is currently the Equestrian Correspondent of The Sunday Telegraph. 
Previous accounts include, totesport, Charles Schwab UK, Rathbone Brothers Plc, Morgan Stanley Capital International, Crop Protection Association and the Energy Saving Trust.

contact-comment:
Comments: Profile:

Mike is a leading international practitioner and trainer in risk and crisis management; communication strategy, and news handling.
He brings unique high-level experience as the former Director-General of the Government Information and Communication Service, and former Head of the Cabinet Office Civil Contingencies Secretariat. 
Mike's clients include Oxford University, and government bodies in the UK, Middle East and South Asia. 
A former journalist, Mike joined Luther in 2004. This followed nearly 20 years in the most senior government communication roles.
He was a director and board member for the Home Office, the Environment and Energy departments, and the Metropolitan Police Service. As such, he was also press secretary to five Cabinet Ministers (Tory and Labour) and the Metropolitan Police Commissioner. 
Mike is Visiting Professor at the University of Westminster, and a Senior Associate Fellow at the Defence Academy of the UK. He is a commentator for the BBC on terrorism and civil emergencies.

contact-comment:
Comments: Profile:

Simon has 20 years' experience in communications consultancy, advising clients across the business world and in the public and voluntary sectors. 
His work has a strong issues focus and he has particular expertise in drawing together a range of communications disciplines - media relations, public affairs, stakeholder relations - to manage those issues and deliver effective results for clients. His current clients include a leading UK regulator, one of the world's largest industrial chemicals and gases businesses, a major high street retailer, a prominent educational institution, and organisations representing healthcare professionals. 
He joined Luther Pendragon in 2000 as managing partner. He was previously a director of Bell Pottinger Public Affairs where in addition to his client-facing role he had responsibility for integrating a significant acquisition into the group

contact-comment: Comments: Entered on 18/09/2003 by Emma Hindmarsh

Comments: Profile:

Dan Guthrie has over ten years communications consulting experience, the last six of which have been at Luther Pendragon. He has experience of working in the House of Commons and the Canadian Senate, for a Conservative Member of the Trade and Industry Select Committee and the Leader of the Opposition respectively. 
Dan has cross sector experience, having worked for clients, both national and multinational, in the utilities, financial services, leisure, media and energy sectors. He has particular understanding of the interaction between the media and political worlds and advises the majority of his clients on the impact of both on their organisations. 
Dan has worked for clients on high profile legislative programmes including communications and gaming legislation and he also has an understanding of the European policy making process and its impact on the UK, particularly around employment and environmental legislation. 
Dan's current clients include theBBC Trust, The Wrigley Company and The Motion Picture Association

Comments: Entered on 01/07/2003 by Maurice Pasgon

Tim is a BSc graduate who has worked in financial PR for 19 years. He is a member of Financial Dynamics’ board and COO of the Company. Prior to joining FD in 1990 he worked at Broad Street (M&A specialists) and Valin Pollen. He has worked on several hostile takeover bids - acting for Glaxo, LWT, GFW, News International, BPI, and latterly OGS – and a variety of agreed deals, flotations and corporate restructurings. He heads the Company’s media sector team, which acts for over a dozen quoted and private groups – one of the most extensive media client lists in financial PR including Aegis, Bloomsbury, ITN, JCDecaux, Wolters Kluwer and T&F Informa. The sector is diverse in structure and his clients reflect this, covering publishing, television and business media. While focused on the media sector, he also acts for major FTSE clients Reckitt Benckiser, Shire and easyJet
